loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shirts to sell to customers

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 41 years old, a married man with 5 children aged between 1 and 13 years. Three of the children attend school. He has farmed for 18 years and will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow maize to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fish vending. Rebecca is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 62 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de La Matanza, ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como actividad económica principal.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado, pollo y verduras, con más de 13 años en el rubro. Su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de pescado, pollo y verduras para aumentar el stock de su negocio. Con esto Victoria espera satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor nivel de ingresos aumentando así su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria is 62 years old and is in a common-law marriage relationship. She lives with her partner and their son in their own house in the district of La Matanza in Morropon province in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru. Life there is peaceful and most of the people engage in agriculture or livestock as their main source of income.

Victoria sells fish, chicken and vegetables and has been doing so for more than 13 years. She runs her business out of her house and has very good personal and business references. She will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of fish, chicken and vegetables so she can increase her business' stock of merchandise. In this way Victoria hopes to satisfy the tastes and needs of her customers, thus increasing her income and improving her quality of live and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish, chicken and vegetables to increase her business' stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: Julio de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el posee un taller de mecánica automotriz desde hace 8 años, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, arena, hierro, laminas y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Julio is 40 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife and their two children. Julio has had a car repair shop for eight years. He wants to make improvements to his home by building a room in the space shown in the photograph. In order to carry out this work, Julio is applying for a loan to buy cement, bricks, sand, iron and metal sheeting, and to pay labourers so that he and his family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, iron and metal sheeting, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand and cement, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Arhon

texts.en:
Arhon is a 37-year-old fish vendor from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is married and has five children. Arhon has been in the fishing business for more than a year now, and this is the source of his income.
Arhon is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this, he will be able to improve his stocks thus allowing him to sell more fish to his customers.
In the future, Arhon wants to expand his business and make it a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a hardworking woman. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 to 15. Ruth's husband has been involved in fishing for three years now and she attends to her small Sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items such as sugar, coffee, condiments, noodles, toiletries and canned goods. Aside from this, she also sells lato (sea grapes seaweed). She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more sea grapes seaweed and ingredients for food vending like sugar, cooking oil, and seasoning. In the future, Ruth would like to expand her business to support her family and to save so she can send her children to school. She also dreams of having a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy sea grapes seaweed and ingredients for food vending like sugar, cooking oil, and seasoning.

loans.name: Ugulkhon

texts.en:
Ugulkhon is 57 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She is widowed and has a child.

She started her own business deal with buying and selling clothes and fabrics 7 years ago since her husband had died. She has worked in a local market during the 7 years and has great experience in retailing. She buys in bulk from the central market, which is located in the capital of Tajikistan, and sells in a local market of her region. She has regular customers.

Ugulkhon is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy clothes and fabrics for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy clothes and fabrics for increasing working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther has sold secondhand clothing for six years now at the market. She has completed elementary school so she can read and write, which has helped her a lot in her business dealings with customers. Esther is 43 years old and enjoys selling because it has helped her come into contact with different characters, especially at the market. She is requesting for a loan amount of GHS 1,800 to buy one high-grade bale of secondhand clothing to sell to customers. She will use the profit to increase a savings and expand her work.

loans.use: To buy one high-grade bale of secondhand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Gina requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.She has been in the business for 6 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 7 times in the past to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Yakubjon

texts.en:
Yakubjon is a smart man. He is not married and he lives with his parents. Yakubjon studies at the capital of Tajikistan. He reads a lot of books and usually goes to the library. His parents are proud of him because he is clever and hard-working. His aim is to be a high quality specialist and to work for society. 

Yakubjon now needs your financial support because his parents do not have money to pay for his tuition. Yakubjon is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Kimoyo

texts.en:
Kimiyo was born in 1966, and she is a very hardworking woman with a kind heart. She is divorced and has a child. Kimiyo is an educated person. She is a teacher, and she teaches English. Kimiyo also earns additional income from animal husbandry. 

Kimiyo is the only provider for her family and that’s why she lives poorly. She must buy coal for the winter season but she does not have enough money for it. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS (Takijistani somoni) to buy coal for the winter season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal for the winter

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe tiene 52 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace 52 años, ya que es una herencia que sus padres de brindaron. Ella se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de frutas de temporada y hojas de huerta, las cuales son utilizadas por sus clientes para la preparación de platillos como: riguas de elote, tamales de gallina, de cerdo y pato, dicha actividad la realiza desde muy joven. Guadalupe desea encementar el piso de la entrada de su vivienda ya que en época seca el polvo causa enfermedades respiratorias a su familia y en época lluviosa se produce mucho lodo en la entrada de su vivienda que se vuelve resbaladizo causando accidentes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para encementar el piso de la entrada de su vivienda. Expresa estar muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido anteriormente.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 52 years old and has lived in her own home with her family for 52 years, this is because it was an inheritance that her parents gave to her. She earns a living with her business selling seasonal fruits and banana leaves, which are used by her customers to make dishes like corn fritters, and chicken, pork, and duck tamales. She has done this since she was very young.

Guadalupe wants to set the floor of the entrance to her home in concrete since in the dry season the dust causes respiratory sicknesses in her family, and in the rainy season it produces a lot of mud at the entrance of her home which turns slippery and causes accidents. For this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to pay for cement, sand, gravel and manual labor to set the entrance to her home in concrete. She expresses much appreciation for the support she received previously.

loans.use: to pay for cement, sand, gravel and manual labor to set the entrance to her home in concrete.

loans.name: Biby

texts.en:
Biby is an entrepreneurial person who is married and has a son.

She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 5 years. Little by little, with the passing of time and years, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to the animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. Many of her customers are local butchers who are glad for her work. 

Biby is looking for a loan to buy young cattle for increasing her working capital. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy young cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Esther, 42 years old, has been selling rice cookers for six years now at the market. She completed elementary school, so she can read and write, an ability that has helped her a great deal in her dealings with customers. Esther enjoys selling because it helps her come into contact with a variety of people, especially at the market. 

Esther is requesting a loan amount of GHS 1,300 to buy more rice cookers to sell. She will use her profits to increase her savings and expand her work.

loans.use: To buy more rice cookers to sell.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 45 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 11, 15 y 16 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida con la venta de frutas de temporada que realiza desde hace 10 años, y se siente muy feliz de poder tener esta fuente de ingresos desde hace tanto tiempo. Ana desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, desde hace mucho tiempo, pero no ha logrado hacerlo por la falta de liquidez económica, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible y así evitar que en época de lluvia esta se filtre deteriorando sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, is a woman who lives in her own home with her life partner and their three children ages 11, 15, and 16. She makes a living selling seasonal fruit, a job she’s done for ten years. She is happy to have had this source of income for so long.

Ana has wanted to replace the roof of her home for awhile, but she hasn't been able to because she lacked capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized laminate, wood, and nails to replace the roof of her home as soon as possible so she can avoid her few belongs from being ruined during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood, and nails to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Panama Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Panamá está integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas, el cual es coordinado por la señora Maribel de 45 años de edad, acompañada, por lo que desea es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, se dedica a la compra-venta de calzado y ropa desde hace quince años en las calles de la localidad, esto le ha permitido ser reconocida en su comunidad. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de zapatos de niños, niñas y adultos; pacas de ropa como pantalones, shores, camisas, talladores, pijamas, etc. La segunda socia es la señora Adriana de 24 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos Avon. Y la tercera socia es la señora Margarita de 54 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de calzado y ropa.
texts.en:
The Panamá Solidarity Group consists of three hardworking women. The group's leader is 45-year-old Señora Maribel, who is married and wants to improve her family's quality of life. Señora Maribel has for 15 years run a business buying and selling clothing and footwear on the streets of her  neighborhood, and she's become well-known in the community. Señora Maribel is applying for a loan for the purchase of shoes for adults and children and bundles of clothing items such as pants, shorts, shirts, underwear, pajamas, and other items. 

The second member of the group is Adriana, age 24, who sells clothing and Avon cosmetics. The third member is 54-year-old Margarita, who also sells clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for adults and children; bundles of clothing such as pants, shorts, shirts, pajamas, and other items to increase sales.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Estrella plans to extend her store, for she desires to add more products to increase her inventory and profit. She dreams to buy a house and lot for her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell seaweed business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed to sell through her business. Airene has been in this business for 2 years, and she earns additional income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Rosalie is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marietta works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marietta is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Marietta has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Alma works hard to support her family. She has a seaweed business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Alma is borrowing 6,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities with her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 61 years old and married with five children.

Ma. Luz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Ma. Luz has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from tricycle passenger transport.

Ma. Luz aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 34 years old and single with two children, one of whom is in school. Mary Rose works very hard to provide for her family.

Mary Rose runs a food-vending business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food production like flour, sugar, etc.

Mary Rose has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food production like flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. This is the source of her income.
Nani is asking for a loan to buy new stocks of supplies to sell in here store including canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, biscuits and bread. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers for her store.
In the future, Nani hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy new stocks of supplies to sell in her store including canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, biscuits, bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Iloilo, Philippines. She is engaged in a hog-raising business. Alma has been in the business for more than 20 years now.

Alma wants to expand her hog-raising venture but lacks the financial resources to do so.

Alma is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed. This loan will allow her to raise healthy pigs, which she can sell to the market after several weeks.

In the future, Alma has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Adelina works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fishing. Adelina is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish-making business.

Adelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies to make dried fish.

loans.name: Ana Donna

texts.en: Ana Donna is 49 years old and married with two children, who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ana Donna has a grocery store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years. Ana Donna has requested a 60,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Ana Donna would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is a 34-year-old married mother of seven children, five of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

For two years now, Charlyn has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. 

In the future, Charlyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Marcelina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marcelina is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Marcelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and pig-fattening businesses. Lolita is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Anecita works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweeds business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Anecita is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production for her seaweeds business.

Anecita has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé majoritairement de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 27 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, de condiments, de produits cosmétiques, de pastèques et du charbon de bois. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Maïmouna (femme arrêtée en 3ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  17 pièces de pagnes wax en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Daoudabougou à une clientèle mixte. Madame Maïmouna espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is mainly made up of polygamous women. They are on average 27 years old with three children. They all live in Daoudabougou, one of the districts of Bamako and met through neighbourhood links. The members of this group work in the small trade of clothing, condiments, cosmetic products, watermelons, and charcoal. In the interests of increasing their reserve stock, the members of this group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and this is their first solidarity loan.
Mrs. Maïmouna (the third woman from left to right in the photo) has a good reputation for her clothing sales. She plans to use her loan to buy 17 wax pagnes wholesale in Bamako. She sells her goods retail in Daoudabougou to a mixed clientele. Mrs. Maïmouna hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business. In this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to buy a plot of land for lodgings.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana es una mujer de 49 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 17 años de edad. Juan es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de frutas de temporada, la que cual realiza desde hace 15 años. Juana desea construir un cuarto, porque siente que viven en hacinamiento con los miembros de su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir un cuarto de lámina que le permita tener una mayor comodidad y seguridad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Juana is a 49-year-old woman who lives in her own house with her 17-year-old son. Juana is an enterprising woman who, for the last 15 years, has made a living running her business selling seasonal fruits. 

Juana would like to build a new room because she feels that her family live in over-crowded conditions. Because of this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: corrugated metal sheets, wood and nails to build the room, allowing her to live more comfortably and securely in her home.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets, wood, and nails to build a room, allowing her to live more comfortably and securely in her home.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, el socio retorno a ejercer su carrera de  guía de turismo, el socio ahora realiza tours como Valle Sagrado, City Tours, Machupicchu entre otros, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de boletos turísticos.
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the Amauta Communal bank. He has returned to his career as a tour guide, and is now doing tours such as Valle Sagrado, City Tours, Machu Picchu, and others. He is a responsible and hard-working person. He wants to be able to keep working so that he can keep supporting his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy tourist fares. He is very thankful for the opportunity offered though this platform, and at the same time he promises to make all of the payment as outlined in the schedule.

loans.use: to buy tourist fares.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a 42-year-old married father of two from Iloilo, Philippines. He runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items.

Jonathan wants to expand his business but lacks the capital to do so. He is therefore requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as bread and biscuits, noodles, soft drinks and beverages, soap and detergents, toiletries, canned goods. condiments and rice. This loan will enable Jonathan to improve his inventories, thus attracting more buyers in his store. 

In the future, Jonathan hopes to make his business more profitable and productive. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell including bread and biscuits, noodles, rice, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela lives in Carles, Iloilo. She is aged 36. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store and has also been engaged in fishing with her husband for ten years now. She works hard for her four children, age 2 to 16. 

She is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fishing nets.The availability of sturdy nets is an ideal way to maximize time and effort in fishing. Estela hopes that the loan from Kiva through CEVI will help increase her business profitability.

Her profit will be utilized for school fees, reinvestment in fishing and the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is positive that she could improve her business more if the Kiva community lends her an additional 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more products displayed on her store. An increase on sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also help her business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Arlene wants to become rich and successful through all of her hard work in business. She dreams of giving her family a good life. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the family's daily needs and expenses.

She is very positive that she could further improve her business if you will lend her an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also make her business become more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Juanita hopes that her business will become bigger and will continue to help support the needs of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Aida is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a plastic bag-making business in the Philippines. Fe has been in this business for 10 years now. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Chonalyn

texts.en:
Chonalyn is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school. Chonalyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buying and selling of home products business in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Chonalyn has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Chonalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Dinah works hard to support her family. She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns income from selling coconut. 

Dinah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She is requesting a new loan of PHP 19000 in order to buy more stocks of nipa to sell

Dinah hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa to sell.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Celestina works hard to support her family. She has a seaweed business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fishing. 

The recipient of one previous loan from NWTF, Celestina is requesting a new one for PHP 7000 to buy farm supplies for her seaweed production business.  

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma works hard to support her family. Guillerma is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Guillerma requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Guillerma has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Guillerma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera con dos hijos, y reside con ellos en un sector que pertenece a Cofradía, Cortes. Ana trabajó un tiempo en una maquila y por estar mas cerca  de sus hijos decidió tener su propio negocio. Lleva 20 años de dedicarse  a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, vende blusas, camisas, calcetas, vestidos, pantalones, ropa interior tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, y también vende cosméticos. Este negocio lo logró instalar en el área del mercado y lo ha mantenido activo mediante la inversión de varios préstamos que ha solicitado a la institución. Actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 lempiras para la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y aprovechar la demanda de esta temporada para obtener más ingresos. Su sueño es terminar de remodelar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Ana, 43, is a single mother with two children. She lives with them in a sector in Cofradía, Cortes. Ana worked for some time in a factory. To be closer to her children, she decided to have her own business. She has been selling clothing and cosmetics for twenty years. She sells blouses, shirts, socks, dresses, pants, and underwear for women, men and children. She also sells cosmetics. She managed to install her business in a market and she has kept it active through the investment of various loans through the institution. 

She is currently applying for another loan of 10,000 Honduran lempiras to buy clothing for women, men and children in order to take advantage of the demand this season to earn a higher income. Her dream is to finish remodeling her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, men, and children in order to take advantage of the demand this season to earn a higher income.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Leticia; la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de molinera, ella muele granos como habas, trigo entre otros productos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia lleva desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz entre otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member, Leticia, still earns a living as a miller.  She grinds grains like beans, wheat, and other products.  She has been in this business for a long time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it.  She wants to be able to keep on working to support her family.

Leticia's requesting the loan to buy corn and other products.

She's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy corn and other products

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
Shakir is a 59-year-old married man. He has two children. His kids are young. His son is married but his daughter is single. Shakir lives in Agdas. His monthly income is 140 AZN.

He has been working as a master of construction for 15 years. Though he is old, Shakir is a hard worker. Now he has one problem, about water. He does not have a bathroom in his house. It is hard for his family, especially for him after work when he needs take a bath.

For this reason  that  Shakir  is applying for a  loan to build a bathroom at his house.

Shakir hopes lenders can help him.

loans.use: to build a bathroom at his house.

loans.name: Ameley

texts.en: Ameley is 45 years old, married, and a trader who lives in Chorkor-Accra. She is an elementary school leaver and has been with ID-Ghana for four years. She has been selling smoked fish for six years in Chorkor and she buys the fish from the wholesalers, smokes, and sells them to her customers. She has a sample of the products in the photo. The fish business in Ghana is very good and Ameley will use her loan request of GHS 1,700 to buy fish to smoke and drinks to sell to customers. She has been able to repay her previous loans successfully so is happy to receive Kiva's support.

loans.use: To buy fish to smoke and drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Allin Muju Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agripina ella es conviveinte y tiene 37 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de frutas , la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende platanos, naranjas y manzanas,  la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos y uvas . 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto, porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de pollos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de confección de ropa, negocio de carpintería y negocio de construcción.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecid
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Allin Muju" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Agripina, 37, has a partner and four children. She works in her business selling fruit. She brings the fruit to various places. She sells bananas, oranges, and apples. She has already worked in this business for several years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a property where she can sell fruit. She is applying for a loan to buy oranges, bananas and grapes. She is happy about this loan and she promises to comply with the payment of her installments. 

The member whose photo is attached to the group photo took her photo after the group took theirs. She asked for permission for work-related reasons. The other members of this group have businesses selling chickens, groceries, homemade clothing, carpentry and a construction business.

This borrower is grateful to those who make up part of her dream through this means. She promises to pay her installments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas and grapes.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita engages in making and selling hotcakes. Hotcakes are round, flat cakes cooked on a griddle or inside a skillet. It is best for merienda (snacks). She is a 61-year-old married woman with ten children. Her youngest child is 16. Her husband earns a living by being a carpenter.

Rosita is asking a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more supplies like four, sugar, margarine and flavoring. These will be used to produce more hotcakes that she will sell in her local community. Her income will slowly go higher so she can continue pay her loan and cover other household expenses.

In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business to make it productive. She hopes it will be the start of her recovery and will eventually result in a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like four, sugar, margarine and flavoring.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 44 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional seafood to sell.

Mary Ann has been in business for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood to sell

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel works hard to support her family. Anabel is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Anabel has been in this business for 17 years now.

In the future, Anabel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Salvacion is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en: Consolacion, 39 years old, is a married woman with four children (three children are in school). She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Consolacion has a business farming corn in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Consolacion requested a 6,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Consolacion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jovencianita

texts.en:
Jovencianita works hard to support her family. Jovencianita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Jovencianita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Jovencianita has been in this business for 15 years now.

Jovencianita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 69 years old and married with one child.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Violeta has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from recycled materials.

Violeta aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Dolores has been in this business for 25 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita is 57 years old and a widow with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Ramonita has been running the general store for 35 years and also earns income from coconut wine. Ramonita requested a 28,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Ramonita has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. Ramonita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Samat's Group

texts.en: Samat’s group lives in a rural village in the Phnom Penh province of Cambodia. Samat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a motor driver and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and one man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en:
Normalita is 51 years old and a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Normalita has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. She requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Normalita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad es un hombre de 63 años de edad, separado, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es el arreglo de bicicletas.
Él es independiente, constante, responsable, paciente, buen oyente, solidario y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘el Torno’ una comunidad rural ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad en automóvil, caracterizada por el comercio agrícola que reúne a productores campesinos y vendedores/distribuidores de la ciudad, el clima del lugar es cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante en día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Trinidad es de tez morena, cabello gris, ojos marrones, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la realiza en; su casa propia construida de metal, que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la bicicletica y básicamente se ocupa del arreglo de; Manillares, Pedales, Horquillas, Guardabarros, Platos, Bielas, Faros, Luces, direcciones y otros. Su negocio es muy demandado en el lugar debido a que no existen caminos y la única manera de movilizarse es mediante bicicleta o motocicleta. “la bicicleta es mi mundo, escuchar el sonido limpio de la cadena rodando al aire, es música para mis oídos… ” Comenta. Su sueño es tener una bicicletería más grande. Él desea realizar la compra de repuestos para bicicleta por mayor, como; llantas, rodamientos y otros, que son los de mayor desgaste y se deben cambiar constantemente.
Es por esos motivos que Trinidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para bicicleta por mayor para contar con material de trabajo.
texts.en:
Trinidad is a 63-year old man, separated, with grown-up children. He has a business repairing bicycles. 

He is independent, consistent, responsible, patient, caring, hard-working and a good listener, . He carries out his work in the 'el Torno' rural community which is located 45 minutes in car from the city. The area is known for its agriculture, bringing together the agricultural producers and the sellers / distributors from the city. The climate in this area is hot, tropical and humid, with a year-round temperature of between 21-35 degrees centigrade during the day. 

Trinidad is dark skinned and petite with grey hair and brown eyes. His mother tongue is Guarani which is spoken where he lives, but he also speaks Spanish in the wider society. He lives in his own house made of metal which has electricity and a private water well. He works in the bicycle trade and his work basically involves repairing: handlebars, pedals, forks, mudguards, chain wheels, connecting rods, headlights, lights and steering etc. 

His business is very demanding because where he is located there are no roads and so the only way to get around is by bicycle or motorbike. 

He comments: "Bicycles are my world: hearing the clean sound of a chain going round in the air is like music to my ears...".

His dream is to have a bigger bicycle shop. He hopes to buy wholesale bicycle parts such as; wheels. bearings and other parts which suffer the most wear and tear and need to be constantly changed. 

For these reasons, Trinidad is requesting a loan to buy wholesale bicycle parts to have material to work with.

loans.use: to buy wholesale bicycle parts to have material to work with.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy leather, nylon thread, fabric, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es: Marta de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijas, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos  desde hace 3 años, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos de su hogar,ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pollos para continuar con la crianza.
texts.en: Marta, age 35, lives in her own home with her four daughters. She has been raising chickens for three years. With her sales, she is able to cover the household costs. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of more chickens to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie lives in the coastal area of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines. Considering the place, most people in her community rely on fishing to earn a living. She has been fishing with her husband for more than 20 years now. This has been instrumental in raising their three children. Her youngest is 15 years old while the other two are adults. 

Virgie is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and nylon. This will help them to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Virgie hopes to make their business more sustainable and profitable. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her child.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and nylon.

loans.name: Ruth Magaly

texts.es:
Ruth es una señorita de 21 años  de edad, actualmente ella está culminando su estudios superiores. En las mañanas vende ropa de segunda mano en un pequeño espacio ubicado en un lugar céntrico; con el ingreso de estas ventas solventa los gastos de sus estudios superiores. Su sueño  es realizarse profesionalmente. Es por ello que requiere el préstamo para poder tramitar los documentos para su título profesional.
Ruth agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por permitirle alcanzar una de las metas de su vida
texts.en:
Ruth is 21 years old and currently finishing her university studies. In the mornings she sells second-hand clothing in a small space located in a central area. With her income, she covers her tuition costs. Her dream is to be a fully-developed professional. For this reason, she needs a loan in order to transmit the documents for her diploma.
Ruth thanks the Kiva lenders for allowing her to reach one of her life goals.

loans.use: to transmit documents for her diploma.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, cheese curds, beans, pork rind, tomatoes and more wholesale.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 26 years old. He is married to Faith and together they have been blessed with one child of three years. Faith provides additional income for her family.

Nicholas runs a money transfer business, which he has done for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Nicholas has requested his third loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 60,000, which he will use to add float for money transfer services commonly referred to as "M-pesa". He successfully repaid his previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Nicholas will be able to buy a plot and build.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children as he establishes more money transfer businesses in different branches.

loans.use: to add float for money transfer services "M-pesa"

loans.name: Harouna Doro

texts.fr:
Harouna Doro, est un jeune étudiant, âgé de 25 ans qui est en cinquième année d’anglais dans une Université du pays. Il est célibataire sans enfant et vit avec ses parents. Harouna Doro, a initié il y a de cela quatre ans, un petit commerce d’habillement qu’il propose à ses camarades de faculté, il fait aussi de la topographie. Il vient solliciter pour la seconde fois un crédit à l’IMCEC pour améliorer ce commerce. Cette activité, il le mène durant l’année scolaire et en tire un profit qui l’aide à gérer ses besoins d’étudiant.
Harouna Doro désire terminer ses études à l’extérieur et devenir un grand homme d’affaire. Dans un futur proche, il aimerait aussi acheter une photocopieuse et une imprimante pour maximiser son profit. S’il voit son capital augmenter, il pense aussi faire un commerce de fruits car ayant bien analysé, il trouve qu’il pourrait les exploiter et en tirer profit.
texts.en:
Harouna Doro is a young student.  He is 25 years old and in his fifth year of studying English at one of the universities in his country.  He is single, has no children and lives with his parents.

Four years ago, Harouna Doro started a small business selling clothing to the students on his faculty.  He is also studying topography.

This will be the second loan for Harouna Doro, from the field partner, UIMCEC.  He conducts his business during the academic year and the profit that he makes has helped to pay for the costs associated with his studies.  He would like to study further abroad, and then become a successful businessman.

In the near future, he would like to buy a photocopier and printer to improve his profits.  If he is able to increase his working capital enough, he would like to begin also selling fruit, as his analysis has shown that this should make him a further profit.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Madilyn

texts.en:
Madilyn is 36 years old and married with two children.

Madilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  Madilyn has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Madilyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 54-years-old and married with eight children.

Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

Cristina has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Cristina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de loroco desde hace 4 años comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para continuar con sus cultivos y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The face of the youth in this photo has been obscured because she is 20 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She has cultivated loroco for four years. She sells her produce in various markets. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her child. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers, manure, pesticides, and herbicides, and to improve the land shown in the photograph. This way she will be able to continue with her cultivation and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en: Ruqiya is a 42-year-old married woman. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Ruqiya has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires, tools, and auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Ruqiya is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires, tools, and auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Zaib Unnisa

texts.en: Zaib Unnisa is a 45-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and her client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of six children. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 60,000 PKR, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet customers' orders to gain more profits and fulfill her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet customers' orders to gain more profits

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 59 years old and a widow with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more chips, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Elsa has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from fishing and pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more chips, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Jizza Mae

texts.en:
Jizza Mae is 25 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Jizza Mae is in an agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Jizza Mae has been in business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is 50 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Nerissa has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Nerissa has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Nerissa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en: Lim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Lim makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Siman's Group

texts.en:
Siman’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Siman makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work running a grocery at home to support her family. There is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water in her village. 

Siman is requesting a loan to buy a water filter at home. Her group members will buy water filters as well. Having a water filter will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Nasreen also provides sewing services and earns income to contribute to managing the household with her husband.
 
Nasreen is in need of different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business. However, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she applied for Kiva loan from its Field Partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help her increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Carmen

texts.es: Esperanza de 41 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero y de engorde desde hace 10 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ganado para continuar con la crianza y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Esperanza is a 41 year old single mother who lives in her own house with her 4 children. She has worked raising cows for milk and meat for 10 years. She sells her product in the area surrounding where she lives. She is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to continue with her work and to create greater revenue.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 42 years old, married, and she has one child who is in school.

Maria Fe is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Maria Fe has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 40-year-old woman who is married to John, who adds additional income to support their family, and they are blessed with five children.  Regina has been running a cereals stall for a period of three years, earning herself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Regina was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 30,000. She intends to use this amount to add additional maize and beans cereals to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Regina plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans cereals to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices, and juices to complete customers' demands efficiently to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices, and juices to complete customers' demands efficiently to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jennifer works hard to support her family. She farms seaweed in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Jennifer is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, etc. for her seaweed farm business.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, etc.

loans.name: Bagh Bibi

texts.en: Bagh, 34 and a mother of three, is a loving housewife. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transportation services within Lahore. He is very hardworking. He manages day-to-day expenses with difficulty given his small salary. His rickshaw needs repair, but he doesn't have the money to pay the bills. Bagh has therefore requested a loan to help her husband pay for the repair expenses. Bagh is pleased that their income will not be disturbed and her husband will be able to drive his rickshaw normally.

loans.use: To cover the repair costs for her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Sikieng's Group

texts.en: Sikieng’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sikieng works as a farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 41-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Delia has a general store business in the Philippines. Delia requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of goods to sell in her general store.

Delia has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elisa has a lechon (roasted pigs) business in the Philippines. Elisa requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy pigs to make her lechon (roasted pig).

Elisa has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy pigs to make her lechon (roasted pig).

loans.name: Chean's Group

texts.en:
Chean’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chean works as farmer to support his family. 

In the group's village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members safeguard the health of their families. Moreover, they will save both money spent on medical expenses and time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter which will provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y colocando puertas y ventanas, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, puertas, balcones, vidrios para ventanas y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su hija puedan vivir cómodas y seguras.
texts.en: Rosa is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her daughter. She works selling cosmetics. She wants to improve her house plastering the walls and installing the doors and windows. So she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy cement, sand, doors, grills, glass for the windows and pay for labor so that she and her daughter can live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, doors, grills, glass for the windows and pay for labor.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 23 years old. She is married to James, and together they have been blessed with one child of 3 years. James provides additional income for his family.

Alice is a barber/salonist, a business she has done for the last nine years now. She also is a tailor.

Alice has requested her second loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 36,000, which she will use to buy new shaving machines for her growing barber shop.

With the anticipated profits, Alice will be able to pay her bills as well as her loan.

Her hope and dream for the future is to be successful.

loans.use: to buy more shaving machines.

loans.name: Fanny Lucia

texts.es:
Fanny tiene  48 años de edad es soltera y tiene dos hijos vive en el canton San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Salado Chico, pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco 2.
Ella se dedica a la cria y venta de animales como cerdos y gallinas, solicita el credito para la compra de mas animales para engordarlos y para su mantenimiento que es la comida, para asi mejorar el negocio y solventar a su familia ya que es sola, las compras realiza en San Miguel cada 8 dias en la feria de San Miguel.
Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos terminen los estudios y cumplir con las demas metas propuestas .
en su tiempo libre le gusta tejer y pasearse con sus hijos en el parque de su comunidad.
texts.en:
48-year-old Fanny is single and has two children. She lives in the canton of San Miguel, province of Bolivar, community of Salado Chico and is a member of the San Francisco 2 community association. She works raising and selling animals such as pigs and chickens and is requesting this loan to buy more animals for fattening and to purchase food for maintaining her animals. This will allow her to improve her business and support her family, as she is a single parent. She makes her purchases weekly in the San Miguel market. 

Her biggest dream is for her children to finish their studies and to accomplished all of her goals. In her spare time, she likes to knit and go to the park with her children.

loans.use: to buy animals to improve her business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 37 years old. She is married and lives in the small village of Zugdidi district with her husband and three children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, 300 nut trees, a pig, and several hens. Nana sells the harvested nuts locally at a good price. 

She wants to start a husbandry business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,300 GEL and purchase a cow. Once the cow is purchased Nana will start producing dairy products to sell. She will gain more income and with increased income she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start producing dairy products

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 43-year-old married woman. She is been in the work of embroidery by hand. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for its embellishment; this will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for its embellishment

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Kosar is a 44-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Kosar’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Kosar has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Kosar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Aneeta

texts.en:
Aneeta is a 32-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Aneeta’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family’s expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Aneeta has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with new auto body and tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers.

Aneeta is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with new auto body and tools for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Litein. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained a lot of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Nyamira area is very populated and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high.
