Like many farmers from her region, Jenifer finds poultry farming very enjoyable. Her biggest challenge is meeting the high demand. 

Jenifer lacks funds to increase her poultry farming and requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES, which she will use to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through Juhudi Kilimo, she is able to buy more poultry. With the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, which will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets. The extra income will be used to permanently change her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Amable Grimaneza

texts.es:
Grimaneza tiene 31 años de edad es soltera tiene 3 hijos es una persona humilde que vive en San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Salado chico, pertenece a la comunidad San Francisco 2.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace algunos años con esta actividad mantiene a sus tres hijos, solicita el credito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y semilla para sembrar maiz, gracias a este credito podra mejorar la produccion de los sembrios. Realiza las compras en la feria de San Miguel cada 8 dias.
Su sueño es comprar terrenos para sembrar mas y mejorar su estabilidad economica. En su tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a  la familia.
texts.en:
Grimaneza is 31 years old. She is single and has 3 children. She is a humble person who lives in San Miguel in the Province of Bolivar in a community called Salado Chico, which belongs to the community San Francisco 2.

She has worked in agriculture for a number of years and supports her 3 children with this work. She is requesting a loan to buy inputs, fertilizer and seeds to plant corn. Thanks to this loan she can improve her crop production. She makes the purchases in the market in San Miguel every 8 days. Her dream is to buy land to grow more and improve her financial stability. In her free time she likes to be with her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to plant corn.

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
Kan’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. 

Kan works as farmer to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families. The members of Kan's Group will also save not only money spent on medical expenses but also time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter which will provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en: SreyMom’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. SreyMom works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Narim's Group

texts.en: Narim’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Narim works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Moko Sane Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Moko sane (be a helper) and are into smoked fish, kenkey (cook corn paste), and assorted soap. They have known each for so many years and are still together, living in the same neighborhood.

Elsie is the group representative, is 42 years old, and is staying with family in her extended family's house, and she also attended school at the elementary level. She has sold assorted soaps for the past six years, which she uses to take care of the family financially. She is taking this loan amount of GHS 3,900 together with her colleagues, Rosemary and Kate.

She will use her portion to purchase more assorted soaps to sell to her customers on her sixth loan cycle. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more assorted soaps to sell to her customers on her sixth loan cycle.

loans.name: El Halcon Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario el Halcón está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras y laboriosas quien es coordinado por la señora Yuribia de 26 años de edad, y es propietaria de una tienda de calzado desde hace seis años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de sandalias, zapatos tenis, zapatillas, etc. Con los financiamientos anteriores ha logrado sustentarse y lograr mantener su familia. Otra de las integrantes es la señora Dora de 32 años de edad y es propietaria de una tienda de ropa usada y compra-venta de cosméticos Avon, y doña Silvia tiene la edad de 43 años y se dedica a la venta de helados, hielos, y alquiler de sillas y mesas en su localidad.
texts.en:
The El Halcón solidarity group is formed by three entrepreneurial and hardworking women and is coordinated by 26-year-old Yuribia, who has been the owner of a shoe store for six years. She is asking for the loan to buy sandals, sneakers, shoes, etc. With the previous loans she has managed to support herself and her family. 

Another of the members is 32-year-old Dora; she is the owner or a used clothing store and sells Avon cosmetics. And 43-year-old Silvia makes a living by selling ice cream and ices and by renting chairs and tables in her area.

loans.use: to buy sandals, sneakers, shoes, etc., and to increase her profits in the business.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Introducing Layla, a 63-year-old widowed mother of five daughters, who sacrificed her whole life working as a tailor from her house to provide her daughters with a better standard of living and education.

Layla was, and still is, the sole breadwinner of her family. It all started at the age of 21 when she decided to learn fashion design and tailoring. She proved to be a smart learner, excelled at it, and was recruited to a well-known fashion-design atelier in Beirut.

Being the proud mother of 5 daughters, she had to put her career and dreams on hold for a long time till she met Al Majmoua, who revived her dreams and helped her set-up her own atelier.

This was 12 years ago... Since then, Al Majmoua and Layla have been working hand in hand and her business has been growing allowing her to proudly sustain the needs of her family but also create jobs for 3 women tailors.

Layla was selected to be one of 6 women entrepreneurs who displayed their collection in a fashion show that was held in December 2007, in the framework of the Women Micro Entrepreneurs and the World of Fashion project funded by Save the Children, which benefited 300 women tailors, as the outcome of a one year intensive preparation. The work of these amazing beneficiaries was recognized by Fashion TV Arabia who offered media coverage for this event.

Layla was also selected by PlaNet Finance Foundation as the “Micro-Entrepreneur of Honor” for the year 2014. She was supposed to receive her award during the 4th edition of the PlaNet Finance Foundation gala dinner which was organized under the auspices of the Cannes Film Festival with the objective of raising 200,000 Euros for the co-financing of programs in the field in order to help women entrepreneurs in Lebanon, Benin, Brazil, Egypt, France, Ghana, Madagascar, Morocco and elsewhere. The gala dinner was followed by an exclusive live auction conducted by the Artcurial Auction House.

Unfortunately, her husband’s health was very critical, so she decided to stay next to him during his remaining few days and couldn’t attend the event. He passed away leaving her alone again with her five daughters and successful career to move on.

With strength and determination, Layla succeeded in providing better standards of living to her 5 daughters and as well as 3 women dressmakers through the creation of job opportunities. She had the chance to contribute to her daughters’ wedding expenses, in addition to urgent medical needs.

Layla has acquired a wide experience in this domain with her greatest features being evening gowns and wedding dresses.

Today, Layla is acquiring her eleventh loan cycle from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary fabrics, textiles and accessories requested for her new designs, especially for the autumn and winter collection and the Holy Christmas and New Year seasons.

Respected and trusted by all, Layla naturally became a role model and peer trainer for other female micro-entrepreneur beneficiaries of the Al Majmoua program.

loans.use: to buy necessary fabrics, textiles and accessories requested for her new designs, especially for the autumn and winter collection and the Holy Christmas and New Year seasons.

loans.name: Señor Manuel Exaltacion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR MANUEL EXALTACION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Mollepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha ella es soltera y tiene 57 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank "Señor Manuel Exaltacion."  They are located in the Mollepata district of Ana province, in the department of Cusco.

Martha, 57, is a member of this group.  She is single and has a son.  She works in a business selling cereals; she sells corn, wheat and quinoa.  Martha works from 8am until 5pm.  She's had the business already for 4 years, and it is doing very well.  Martha's dream is to have her own store where she could sell cereals.  She is requesting a loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

The members in the small pictures attached to this page had their picture taken after the group meeting because they had permission to miss the meeting due to work obligations.

The other members of this group have businesses including: cereal sales, animal sales, a grocery store, and a restaurant. 

Martha thanks all of the lenders who are supporting her dream through these loans, and she promises to make all of her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa

loans.name: Tâm

texts.en:
Mrs. Tâm  works in agriculture, raising marine aquaculture. She  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Tâm is 19 years old, and she is married with two children. Tâm lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tâm's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.  She hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Nyomo No No Okwei 1 Group

texts.en: Juliana is the lady standing on the right in the photo and she is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Juliana is part of the group called Nyomo no no okwei 1 (Be your neighbor's keeper)  and together with Lydia they are requesting a total loan amount of GHS 6,200 to sell groceries, African fabric, rice, and cooking oil. Juliana is a grocery and African fabric seller and has been doing this business for seven years now. Juliana is in the fifth loan cycle with Nyomo no no okwei 1 and has had successful previous loan cycles. Her group meets on Monday where they make loan repayments, savings, and receive training on either business or health. She is staying in a family house and had former education and can read and write very well. She will use her share of the loan to buy more groceries and African fabric to sell to her customers so that she will make more profit.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and African fabric to sell to her customers so that she will make more profit.

loans.name: Lợi

texts.en:
Mrs. Lợi operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Lợi is 47 years old and married with four children. Lợi lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lợi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lợi has been involved in this business for three years. 

The main hardship that Lợi faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Lợi hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy braids and hair weaves for use in her business.

loans.name: Diviterbo

texts.en:
Diviterbo is from Ospital, Aloran. He is 59 years old and is married. 

Diviterbo owns and manages a drugstore business, operating a specialized retail store selling legal drugs in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over six years but earns a meagre income. 

In 2012, Diviterbo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Diviterbo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional pharmacy inventories and used as working capital. This loan will be his fourth loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pharmacy inventories for retail

loans.name: Nyomo No No Okwei 2 Group

texts.en:
This loan group is called Nyomo No No Okwei 2 and is made up of two ladies who live in the same neighborhood and have been together for many years. The women sell groceries and rice. Joycelyn, standing on the right in this photo, is the featured borrower of the group. She is married with three children. For five years now, Joycelyn has been selling groceries from her residence. She finished elementary school and enjoys her job because it is profitable and has earned her many customers. 

Joycelyn, along with her friend, is requesting a 5,500 GHS loan to expand their businesses. She and her friend will hold each other responsible for the repayment of loan.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell to customers

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
This nice and charming woman lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. Her name is Anahit and she is 55 years old. Anahit graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute.She is a specialist of Armenian Language and Literature. As Anahit says, she loves her native language very much and she does her best to teach the children to use right grammar, words and to speak correctly and cutely, since the Armenian words are so nice and so meaningful. 

Anahit has 31 years of pedagogical experience, and she still continues to work at the same school where she started many years ago. She also gives private courses, preparing the pupils for the entrance examinations. Anahit says that she has a very rich library and she especially likes glossary and expository dictionaries and spelling literature, which always helps her to explain to her pupils different and wide meanings of the words, in order to use it rightly and to avoid misunderstandings in speaking and writing. 

Anahit is a widow and now she lives alone; her husband died several years ago. She has a daughter who is married and lives with her family.

This loan she will be happy to get since she wants to enlarge her library with some new methodological literature and dictionaries, and she will also buy a computer, the need for which is also great in her work.

loans.use: to buy some new methodological literature, dictionaries and a computer

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a widowed woman with four children. Rosalina is 39 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosalina has a chicharon making business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Saikal

texts.en:
Saikal is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia. Here is her story:

“I had a happy childhood with my family. I loved the evenings when all the members of our family used to gather and had a dinner together, discussed news and watched TV. Everything got worst with the death of my father, when I was seven years old.

"I live with my mother and two brothers. My mother is a dentist in our village. She has as little as 180 dollars per month salary. My elder brother is 20-year-old. He hadn’t studied at the university because of the financial situation of my family. He used to do different jobs requiring no special skills in order to help mother somehow. My younger sibling goes to school; he loves math and dancing.

"I studied well at school. Since I have been at elementary school, I have tried to participate in all social events within the school and out of it. I used to be a presenter, so loved to talk and share my opinion with others. Thanks to my social activity and good academic performances, I won the full AUCA scholarship for AUCA’s one-year-study at Preparatory Program. 70 students had received such a scholarship, lived in the dormitory and had free meals. It was a great experience for me as I hadn’t lived far from my family and hadn’t seen so much cultural diversity before. That year was full of fun and academic achievements for me. I began to feel myself at home in AUCA and wanted this moment to last. Now I am a freshman and, unfortunately, my family is not able to cover the tuition fees fully. I hope to get a Kiva loan, so that I can concentrate on my studies rather than thinking about finance.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Sarath's Group

texts.en: Sarath’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sarath works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sila's Group

texts.en: Sila’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sila works as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Banthoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Banthoeurn’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Banthoeurn works as a farmer to provide for his family. 

In his village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home would help each of these men safeguard the health of their families. They would also save not just money spent on medical expenses but also time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter which will provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 19 años de edad y vivir en zona de lato riesgo, posee un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras ubicado en el mercado municipal, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The youth who has had her face blurred in the photo is 19 years old and lives in a high risk zone. She has a stand selling fruit and vegetables located in the municipal market. She lives in her own house with her life companion and two children. She is requesting a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale and be able to have more income.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Dilia Patricia

texts.es:
Dilia vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos a quienes les garantiza una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual intenta generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente, junto con su compañero, para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una vida plena. 

Desde hace algunos meses comenzó con gran esfuerzo un negocio de papelería y venta de variedades en un local ubicado en el municipio de Medellin.

Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más productos, Dilia busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de papelería y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos en su negocio.

Con este préstamo la actividad de Dilia tendrá un gran impulso pues mejorara su inventario y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Dilia lives in a domestic partnership and has 3 children, for whom she guarantees a good quality of life thanks to her business. Through her business, she tries to generate income to contribute economically alongside her partner, so that the economic conditions of their home can improve and they can have a full life.

A few months ago, with a lot of effort, she started a business – a shop that sells stationary and an assortment of items, located in the Medellin municipality. 

Due to the fact that her customer base is growing and they are demanding more products each day, Dilia is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of stationary and to offer her customers a greater variety of products in her business.

With this loan, Dilia’s business will have a lot of momentum, since her inventory and sales will improve.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of stationary.

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en:
Annastasia is fifty-six years old. She is married to Michael and together they have been blessed with five children aged between fifteen and thirty-five. Michael is a farmer and provides income for his family through this.

Annastasia is a farmer as well and runs a retail shop business which she has done for the last ten years. She earns a monthly income of 11,500 KES.

Annastasia has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya in the amount of 15,000 KES. She will use this amount to add stocks of retail goods, such as soap, sugar, rice, soft drinks and bread.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to restock her shop and pay her children's school fees.

Her hope and dream for the future is to prosper in business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of soap, sugar, rice, soft drinks and bread

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is fifty-eight years old and works in livestock farming, a business she has been running for the past eight years. Her spouse also provides additional income to support the family and together they have been blessed with three children aged twenty, seventeen and fifteen. 

She has requested a loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy more goats, cows and sheep for rearing and then selling. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her children's school fees.

This is her first loan term and in future she hopes to expand her business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy goats, cows and sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has a retail shop in Machakos town and has been running this business for three years. She is 28 years old and a single mother of three children. 

She will use this loan to expand her business by buying more stock of goods such as maize, beans, and sugar to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay the school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ehab

texts.en: Ehab is 29 years old from Baniswef. He is married with two kids and works as a part time carpenter. He has 12 years of experience in the field but he couldn't afford to buy wood to start his own business. So he requested a 3000 EPG loan from TADE to buy wood and successfully repaid it on due date. Ehab still wants to expand his project so he requested a 5000 EPG loan to buy more wood to increase his sales and develop his project.

loans.use: To buy more wood to increase his sales.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 40-year-old widow from Baniswef. She has four school children and has a small grocery store that her husband used to run before he passed away. After her husband's death, she shut the store for a while but she had to reopen it because her husband's small pension income couldn't cover the family's expenses. Nadia requested a 4000 EPG loan from TADE to buy products to reopen the store and successfully repaid the loan on the due date. Nadia dreams of expanding her small business so she requested another 6000 EPG loan from TADE to buy a refrigerator and some products such as juice, ice cream, and groceries.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and some products such as juice, ice cream, and groceries.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is 28 years old from Baniswef. She is divorced with two kids and lives with her father who is a part time farmer with very low income. Hanan decided to start a small sheep project to cover her children's expenses. She prepared a place in her father's house for the project and requested a 1000 EPG loan from TADE to start the project and successfully repaid the loan on the due date. Now Hanan has gained enough experience and dreams of expanding her project, so she requested a 3000 EPG loan to buy more lambs and goats.

loans.use: To buy more lambs and goats.

loans.name: Moneer

texts.en: Moneer is 47 years old from Baniswef. He is married with a son and a daughter in secondary school. He works as a driver and he takes care of his aged parents. Moneer can't afford his family's expenses and his parents' expensive medications. So he and his wife decided to start a small fattening project and requested a 5000 EPG loan from TADE to buy a head of cattle to start the project.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her carrot crops.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en: Mervat is single 23 years old from Baniswef. She is a graduate of the manufacturing high school but she doesn't have a job so she decided to start a small fattening project in a place she prepared in her house. Mervat requested a 5000 EPG loan from TADE to buy a head of cattle to start her project.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle to start her project.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is 44 years. She is married to Fidelis, and together they have been blessed with four children between the ages of 25 and 13 years.

Celestine is a farmer as well as running a retail shop, businesses she has done for the last 10 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 6,800.

Celestine has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 5,000, which she will use to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings, and to pay her laborers.

With the anticipated profits, Celestine will be able to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future include being an established and prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control products, etc.

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
Winifred is 48 years and is married to Thomas. Together, the couple has been blessed with seven children. Thomas and Winifred are farmers and they support two additional dependents who are seven and 17. She has been a farmer for the past 15 years and earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES. 

Winifred is requesting a 6,750 KES loan with VisionFund to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seedlings to plant. This will be her second loan. Winifred successfully repaid her previous loan. She hopes to use the profits from her loan to purchase an ox to help plow. Winifred’s hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper in business so as to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 60 years old and married with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Edna has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Edna requested a 25,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Edna has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jonadel

texts.en:
Jonadel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Jonadel has been in this business for five years. Jonadel earns additional income from buying and selling seaweed.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Elizbeth

texts.en:
Elizbeth is 42 years old, a married woman and mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Elizbeth has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Elizbeth gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on the rickshaw.

loans.name: Yerlenis

texts.es:
Yerleni, a sus 41 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 

A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 3 años de trayectoria en esta actividad.

Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, porque tiene muy poco surtido; de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de sus ventas.

Yerleni manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio con la ayuda de Interactuar y en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten. 

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
Yerleni, 41, is a charismatic and customer-oriented woman who started a corner grocery to support her family.  She has found the strength and determination to overcome the obstacles she has faced and steadily grown the business over the last 3 years.

Yerleni is applying for a loan that she will use to further strengthen her business.  She will stock her grocery with the everyday products that her customers come to her to buy.  The investment will allow her to provide the products and level of service that will, in turn, deliver higher profits.

Yerleni says that her greatest hope is to use future Interactuar loans to grow her business and, ultimately, build a full-service supermarket.

Supporting this loan application will contribute to the success of Colombian businesswomen!

loans.use: to stock her corner grocery.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, aged 57, has been involved in her business selling embroidered clothing for about 10 years. 

Parveen buys a variety of printed and embroidered clothing from the main city market which she then sells to the people of her local community. She has attained a list of regular customers and earns enough to contribute to the family income. 

Winter is nearing, and Parveen wishes to purchase new items for the coming season. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan in order to buy a variety of clothing for her winter inventory. By taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers, she will be able to increase her sals and earn more income. 

Parveen hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wishes to grow her business. Through all of her efforts with her business, she dreams of providing her children with a good education.

Parveen thanks Kiva's lenders and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing inventory to sell for the winter season.

loans.name: Dainalyn

texts.en:
Dainalyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dainalyn is twenty-six years old and has two children who are in school.

Dainalyn has a business buying and selling ready to wear clothes in the Philippines. Dainalyn requested a loan of 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional clothing items to sell.

Dainalyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Dainalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Cherb's Group

texts.en:
Cherb’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Cherb works as farmer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is forty-five years old and has four children, two of whom are in school. Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods and groceries.

Edna has been in this business for four years now. 

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods and groceries.

loans.name: Shiya's Group

texts.en:
Shiya’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Shiya makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor and sells groceries at home to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 51 years old and is a widowed woman with six children, three of whom are in school. For the past three years, she has been running a business selling used handbags and other items in the Philippines. Her business was damaged by Super Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. Alicia is a very hardworking entrepreneur and she would like to rebuild her business. 

Alicia is requesting a 5,000 PHP bridge loan through NWTF to buy additional items to restart her business activities. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy handbags and items to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 33 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for her family. For the past four years, Alma has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items.

Alma is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, rice, and other products. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, rice, and other items

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Nancy started farming on a small, inherited piece of land, in Siongiroi, a remote village town in the Rift valley area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to Nancy's heart and, every day, she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. 

Through the loan, Nancy will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions, such as rain. 

Nancy believes that, through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Nancy waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 27-year–old single man from Baniswef. His father is on pension and his mother is a housewife and he has three younger siblings. He works as a motorcycle taxi driver. However, the income of the motorcycle taxi and his father's monthly pension money can't cover the family's expenses or the motorcycle maintenance. Therefore, Ahmad decided to start a small poultry project in a place he prepared in their house. His mother will help him with the project as she has good experience in raising poultry. He requested a 3000 EPG loan from TADE to buy poultry such as ducks, chickens, and geese.

loans.use: To buy poultry such as ducks, chickens, and geese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, hats, tennis shoes, and shorts

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is forty-two years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Edna has been in this business for one year and earns an additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Enso Nyame Ye Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of a group called "Enso nyame ye" and have an average age of fifty years. Their respective businesses deal with groceries and jewellery.

Esther is fifty-six years old and sells groceries at her residence in Chorkor. She buys the items (milk, milo, coffee, eggs, sugar, noodles, rice etc.) from the main market and sells to her customers. She has been a member of this group for five years and needs this loan to expand her business. In five successive loans loan cycles, she has been able to make a good savings deposit and has improved her business tremendously.  She attended school to secondary level but decided to join her friends and learn how to trade. Esther is standing on the left of the photo with a sample of her products in her hands.

She needs GHS 4,300 to be able to purchase more milk, milo, coffee, eggs, sugar, noodles and rice to sell to her customers.

Together with her colleague, they need a total of GHS 5,300 to be able to expand their businesses. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more milk, milo, coffee, eggs, sugar, noodles and rice

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is fifty-four years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Edna has been in this business for two years and also earns an additional income from working in a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Younan

texts.en: Younan is 43 years old from Baniswef. He lives with his wife, two children, and his sick, aged mother. He used to work as a tailor but he did not have many customers and the income could not cover his family's expenses. After some research of the demands of the local market, he decided to start a fattening project with his wife with a 5000 EPG loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on the due date. Younan requested another 6000 EPG loan from TADE to purchase two calves. He believes this loan could be another step in his thousand-mile journey as he dreams of having a large fattening project.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en: Asmaa is 22 year old from Baniswef. She is married and has two kids. Her husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver but his income is very small and can't cover his family's expenses. Asmaa decided to help her husband by starting a small grocery project in a place she prepared in her house. Therefore, Asmaa requested a 4000 EPG loan from TADE to buy fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, bananas, oranges, and zucchini. Asmaa believes this loan will change their life.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, bananas, oranges, and zucchini.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 27 from Baniswef. He is married with two kids and has been working as a tailor making curtains for six years. But the monthly income can't cover his family's expenses. So Mohammad requested a 5000 EPG loan from TADE to expand his small business by buying a modern sewing machine and some cloth to make high-quality curtains. Mohammad will sell the curtains to increase his monthly income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a modern sewing machine and some cloth.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna is 34 years old from Baniswef. He is a graduate of the agricultural high school. He is married with a son and a daughter. He takes care of his aged parents and is the only breadwinner of the family. He works as a wood painter and furniture finisher but the lack of modern tools and supplies alienated his customers. This negatively affected his monthly income. So he requested a 10,000 EPG loan to buy new tools and supplies to increases the quality of his work and attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy a 300 liter compressor, paint spraying gun, an electrical sander, and some other tools.

loans.name: Estafanous

texts.en: Estafanous is 29 years old from Baniswef. Estafanos, his wife, two kids, and parents live in the same house. His father doesn't have a job because of his bad health condition and is on mediation, and his mother is a housewife, so Estafanous is the only bread winner of the family. He works as a wall painter for a contractor because he can't afford to buy the tools and the supplies needed for painting. So he requested a 5000 EPG loan from TADE to buy compressor, roller tray and painting brushes to work independently and increase his income. Estafanous believes that this loan will be the first step in his thousand mile journey.

loans.use: To buy a compressor, roller tray and painting brushes.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en: Asmaa is 21 years old from Baniswef. She is single and lives with her mother. The only income Asmaa and her mother has is her father's small pension income. So Asmaa decided to start a small poultry project in a place she prepared on the roof of her house. Asmaa requested a 3000 EPG loan to buy ducks, chickens, and geese to start her small project. Asmaa believes this project will improve their living conditions and allow her to save money for her marriage.

loans.use: To buy ducks, chickens, and geese.

loans.name: Rawheya

texts.en: Rawheya is 48 years old from Baniswef. She is married with five school-age children. Her husband is a civil servant with a very low salary. Two years ago, Rawheya started a small fattening project and used the milk for making cheese for sale to help her husband with the family income. Rawheya wishes to expand her small project so she requested a 5000 EPG loan from TADE to buy a head of cattle.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 24-year-old single man from Jabalia. He opened an electrical repair workshop two years ago. He would like to improve his shop and expand the shop in the future.

Abdallah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy electrical repair parts for his workshop. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to improve his business and increase his productivity. 

Abdallah appears in the photo in his electrical repair workshop.

loans.use: to buy electrical repair parts for his workshop.

loans.name: Maritza Yamileth

texts.es: Maritza, tiene 33 años de edad,  es madre soltera, tiene un hijo a su cargo, con quien reside en una aldea del municipio de Petoa, Santa Bárbara. Maritza, inicio vendiendo ropa por un tiempo y luego logró instalar su propio negocio en su casa. Hace dos años que tiene una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, carnes, churros, refrescos, productos de aseo, huevos, manteca, pastas, pan, café, embutidos, sal y otros.  Su negocio va en crecimiento lleva dos prestamos invertidos con el actual que es por 10,000 lempiras para comprar carnes, arroz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, pan, huevos, churros y refrescos para seguir vendiendo. Su meta a futuro es construir un local mas grande para su negocio y poder vender otros productos nuevos.
texts.en: Maritza is 33 years old, is a single mother with a son in her care and lives in a village in the municipality of Petoa, Santa Bárbara. Maritza started selling clothing for a while and then opened her own business in her home. For the last two years she has had a small grocery store where she sells basic grains, meats, churros, fruit drinks, cleaning products, eggs, butter, pasta, bread, coffee, sausages, salt and other items. Her business has been growing with two loans invested along with the current one, which is for 10,000 Honduran lempiras to buy meats, rice, beans, butter, sugar, bread, eggs, churros and fruit drinks to keep selling. Her future goal is to build a bigger store for her business and to be able to sell other new products.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, beans, butter, sugar, bread, eggs, churros and fruit drinks to stock and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lime, and corn in hundredweights.

loans.name: Monn's Group

texts.en:
Monn’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Monn works as a farmer to provide for his family. 

In Monn's village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home would help each of these men safeguard the health of their families. They would also save money spent on medical expenses and time needed for collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter which provides safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Ret’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. 

Ret works as a farmer to support his family. In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of this group's members safeguard the health of their families. They would also save money otherwise spent on medical expenses and time needed for collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter which provides safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Nilton

texts.en:
Nilton has has two children, one of whom attends school. He lives with his parents. With his girlfriend, Nilton makes cheese for a living. He had earned additional income as a mason for the Achacachi Community but he does not work as a mason anymore. 

Nilton requested a loan, which he will use to buy a milking cow.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Jose Hector

texts.es: Jose de 51 años de edad se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa en casa propia, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 51 years old and has worked in agriculture, planting corn and vegetables, for the past 20 years. He sells his products in various markets located near his home. Jose lives with his wife in his own house, and is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, composts, pest control products, etc. and to improve the land, which is shown in the photograph, so that he can continue with his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, composts, pest control products, etc. and to improve the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy textiles

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban tiene 55 años de edad, es casado, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto con su cónyugue y su menor hijo en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

EL se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes así como para la contratación de peones agrícolas para el período de cosecha. Con esto Esteban espera mejorar la productividad de su cultivo, ofreciendo un producto de mayor calidad a sus clientes, lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá aumentar su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Esteban is 55 years old, married, and lives in his own home, built from rustic materials, with his spouse and their young son. They live in the Pomahuaca district, a community with a warm climate whose population works in agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the province of Jaen, which is part of the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Esteban works in agriculture; specifically, he grows rice. He has experience in this sector and has many good personal and professional references in the area. The loan will be used to buy composts and fertilizers, as well as to hire agricultural workers for the harvest season. With these resources, Esteban hopes to improve the productivity of his crop and so offer a higher-quality product to his clients. This will have a great impact on his level of income and wil allow him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy composts and fertilizers and to hire agricultural workers for the harvest season.

loans.name: Juan Agustin

texts.es: Juan de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los sacos que muestra en la fotografía para luego  comercializarlos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 60 years old and he lives in his own home with his life partner.

He earns a living growing corn and beans. When the harvest is ready, he stores it in the sacks shown in the photo, to then sell in various markets.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control products, etc., so he can continue with his work and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control products, etc.

loans.name: Antonette

texts.en: Antonette is 22-year-old woman who works hard to provide for her daily needs. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Antonette has requested a 4500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Antonette has been in this business for one year. In the future, Antonette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Arrida

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Arrida works hard to support her family. She has a retail vegetable business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from running a general store. Arrida is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell in her vegetable business. Arrida has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Emerita works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming corn in the Philippines and also earns additional income from working in a general store. Emerita is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farming supplies for her business.

Emerita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farming supplies

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina es una madre soltera de 36 años, tiene una hija de 21 años de edad, ellas viven en una comunidad de Sololá, 

Bernardina desde hace nueve años se dedica a la compra venta de mostacias, ropa típica y ropa casual, pues con  el apoyo de su hija ellas salen a vender a diferentes lugares, máximo en los lugares fronterizos donde hay afluencia de turistas, pues desde que ella se quedo sola con su hija busco esta fuente de trabajo para poder cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar, y dar todo lo necesario a su hija,.  

 La visión de Bernardina sobre este trabajo es poder agrandar cada día su negocio, y así generar más ingresos,  ella, necesita de un préstamo para comprar más productos, la meta de Bernardina es conseguir el préstamo ya que ella si necesita de capital de trabajo,  ella es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y se identifica mucho con su negocio, Los sueños de ella es que en un futuro pueda tener un ahorro para mantener su negocio y darle una mejor vida a su hija ya es la única razón  por lo que ella lucha día con día.
texts.en:
Bernardina is 36 years old and a single mother. She has a 21-year-old daughter. Mother and daughter live in a community in Sololá.

For nine years Bernardina has made a living buying and selling bead necklaces, and traditional and casual clothes. Bernardina, with the support of her daughter, goes out to sell her products in different places, especially border areas that have a lot of tourists. After Bernardina was left alone to raise her daughter, she started doing this work in order to cover household costs and to give her daughter everything that she needed.

Bernardina wants to expand her business and earn a higher income. She needs a loan in order to buy more products. Bernardina's goal is to take out this loan as she needs capital. Bernardina is someone who likes to work and likes her business. Bernardina's dream is, in the future, to have savings to keep her business going and to give her daughter - her only reason for working hard every day - a better life.

loans.use: to buy typical clothes and bead necklaces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 54-year-old, married woman with ten children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Susana has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Susana has requested a loan of 26,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell.

Susana has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Flor Rocio

texts.es:
Flor es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.

Todo comenzó hace 18 años cuando trabajaba como operaria en un taller de confección; hoy en día, a sus 52 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 1 empleo directo; trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de pantalones y camisas de uniformes; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina fileteadora, así podrá mejorar su taller, podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Flor sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Flor is a committed and hard-working entrepreneur.  She is a skilled seamstress and makes a living selling her sewing services. 

Flor went to work at 18 as a seamstress in a shop.  She branched out later and now, at 52, has her own workshop with one direct employee.  She works every day and specializes in shirts and pants for uniforms.  Her earnings and her husband's cover the family's expenses.  Flor is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a specialist sewing machine that will allow her to expand the sewing services she delivers.  The investment will allow her to attract new customers and grow her small business.

For the future, Flor wants to increase her output and create new employment opportunities for others.  Her hope is that she can provide a better standard of living for not only her own family, but also the families of those she employs.

loans.use: to buy a specialist sewing machine.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Ran’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. 

To help support her family, Ran works as a farmer and does extra work as a teacher. 

In her village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families. Ran and her group would also save money otherwise spent on medical expenses and time needed for collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter which will provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Po's Group

texts.en:
Po’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Po works as a farmer to help provide for her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home would help each of these women safeguard the health of their families. Po and her group would also save money otherwise spent on medical expenses and time needed for collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter which provides safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Tom's Group

texts.en:
Tom’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Tom works as a farmer to help provide for the family's needs.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home would help each of these members safeguard the health of their families. Tom's Group would also save money otherwise spent on medical expenses and time needed for collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter which will provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Rufat

texts.en:
Rufat is 30 years old, married and has two children he wants to provide for with a good upbringing. He is a kind and hard-working man. The family lives in the Sabirabad region. 
He couldn’t get a higher education and because of that, he decided to start his own farming business. He is growing fruits and vegetables in his own yard. Rufat has 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to help from his father, but his situation is very difficult. He needs to raise fruit but the lack of water in the region is a problem for him. 
Because of this problem, the productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover the family’s needs. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase the productivity again, and the family’s income will rise.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden for his fruit trees.

loans.name: Reyad

texts.en:
Reyad is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah. He lives with his wife and three sons. Reyad works as an employee in the public sector where he receives a low income. This income does not cover all the family needs. Reyad would like to improve the family living conditions. He decided to buy a solar system for heating water. 

Reyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new solar power system for his home. By taking this loan, Reyad will be able to provide hot water for his family using solar-generated power. 

Reyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new solar power system for his home.

loans.name: Jories

texts.en:
Jories is 30 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Jories runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can purchase more inventory such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Jories has already borrowed and successfully repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 3 years, but she also earns additional income from both fish vending and pig fattening.

Jories aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella trabaja como empleada en un comedor, quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y encementando el piso que muestra en la fotografía, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en:
Norma is 40 years old, and she lives in a home of her own with her three children. She works at a restaurant.

She wants to improve her home by replacing the roof and installing a cement floor, as is shown in the photograph. She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to purchase cement, sand, metal sheets, poles and to pay for labor so that she and her family can comfortably live in a clean home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, metal sheets, poles and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es: Rosa de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus hija, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, Rosa quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una cocina externa en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que gana de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo, por eso esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, arena, hierro, laminas y pago de mano de obra y así poder tener un mejor espacio para cocinar los alimentos,
texts.en: Rosa, 44 years old, lives in her own house with her daughter. She works selling food. Rosa wants to make improvements to her house by building an exterior kitchen at the place shown in the photograph, but her earnings from what she sells are not enough for this project. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy cement, bricks, sand, iron, sheet metal and to hire workers, so that she can have a better place to cook her foods.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, iron, sheet metal and to hire workers

loans.name: Unión Pesquera Group

texts.es:
Sentarse bajo la sombra de un árbol de tamarindo, observar el comportamiento de la laguna, la llegada y salida de los pescadores, el golpeteo del agua en las lanchas o chalupas son atributos que ofrece la localidad donde hace 6 años se formó un grupo de préstamo. Su nombre se compone por dos palabras: "unión" por haber consolidado el grupo y "pesquera" debido a que 5 de sus integrantes, Yuliana, Inés, Juana, Abraham y Esteban, se dedica a la venta de mojarra, mientras que Arely vende postres y María Esther, pollo.	
	
Abraham es el menor de sus hermanos, sus padres se han dedicado a la pesca y venta de mojarra desde hace ya 30 años; ellos han sido los maestros de Abraham quien desde hace 3 años desempeña la misma actividad. Él recuerda a sus padres trabajar como equipo desde que era un niño y esa es su máxima inspiración. 

Este es el segundo préstamo de Abraham y el dinero extra le ha permitido comprar más material para mejorar su actividad como redes nuevas, una nevera y una moto de uso para trasladarse en ella a las distintas comunidades a la hora de vender el pescado. Con el nuevo préstamo, Abraham quiere comprar más pescado ya que tiene un pedido de 60 kilos para fin de año y a pesar de salir a pescar diario, el pedido es importante por lo que planea comprar lo que le haga falta para no fallar a sus clientes. 

Abraham comenta que lo que más le gusta de su actividad es adentrarse en la laguna con la chalupa que padres le han regalado. “La mojarra más grande que he pescado pesó casi dos kilos, ha sido una de las mejores experiencias y lo peor que me ha pasado es ya no encontrar transporte de regreso a casa y tener que caminar”.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados por VisionFund y cada una de las personas que los hacen posibles el grupo continua y sus actividades crecen favorablemente.

*Los integrantes decidieron tomarse la fotografía frente a la parte más baja de la laguna, Abraham es el único hombre que se observa en la fotografía.
texts.en:
Sitting under the shade of a tamarind tree, watching the movement of the lake, the coming and going of the fishermen, the crashing of the water against the launches or boats are all characteristics of this place where a communal bank formed six years ago.  Its name is made up of two words, “union” [union] for having consolidated the group and “pesquera” [fishery] because five of its members; Yuliana, Inés, Juana, Abraham, and Esteban sell ‘mojarra’ [a type of fish].  Arely sells desserts, and María Esther sells chicken.

Abraham is the youngest of his siblings.  His parents have been fishing for and selling mojarra for 30 years.  They have been Abraham’s teachers, and he has engaged in this business activity for three years.  He remembers his parents working as a team ever since he was a boy, and this is his greatest inspiration.

This is Abraham’s second loan.  The extra money has allowed him to buy more material to improve his business activity.  He bought things like new nets, a refrigerator, and a motorcycle to get to the different communities when it is time to sell the fish.

With the new loan Abraham wants to buy more fish because he already has an order for 60 kilos for the end of the year.  The order is important, and in spite of going out to fish daily, he plans to buy what he does not have in order to not let down his customers.

Abraham says that what he likes the most about his business activity is getting into the lake with the boat that his parents gave him.  “The biggest mojarra that I caught weighed almost two kilos.  It was one of the best experiences.  The worst that has happened to me is that I could not find transportation back home, and I had to walk”.

Thanks to the loans provided by VisionFund and each one of the people who have made them possible, the group continues and their business activities grow favorably.

*The members decided to take the photograph in front of the lowest part of the lake.  Abraham is the only man seen in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Sina’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. 

To help support her family, Sina works as a tailor and does additional work selling groceries from her home.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home would help each of these women safeguard the health of their families. They would also save money otherwise spent on medical expenses and time needed for collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter which would provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia has a retail shop in Machakos town and has been running this business for two years. She is 29 years old and a single mother of three children. 

She will use this loan to buy more maize flour, sugar and detergents to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya . Her future hopes are to expand her business and to be successful.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena has a retail shop in Machakos town and has been running this business for six years. She is 56 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with one child. 

She will use this loan to buy more maize flour, sugar and beans to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase energy saving jikos (charcoal stoves)

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 62 años de edad, es casada. Su familia es unida, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, patos, gallinas, entre otros, cuenta con más de 08 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para su negocio así como alimento balaceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Agustina espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio, lo que le permitirá tener mayores niveles de ingreso, mejorando así su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina is 62 years old, and she is married. Her family is close, and she lives in a home of her own with her partner in the district of Cayaltí, located in the province of Chiclayo, the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru. She lives in a community that works in commerce, agriculture and raising cattle.

She earns a living by raising and selling small animals such as pigs, ducks, chickens and others, and she has more than 8 years experience in her business. Agustina also has very good personal and professional references in the area.

The loan will be used to purchase more animals for her business, as well as to purchase animal feed to fatten them. With this, Agustina hopes to improve her business' productivity, which will allow her to earn more income and to improve her quality of life, and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for her business and animal feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 57 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with one child. She has a tailoring shop and has been running the business for 10 years. Right now, she makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She also sells and supplies textiles to several tailors in the area. 

She will use this loan to buy tailoring materials such as sewing materials, textiles, threads and buttons for making more dresses, blouses, shirts and trousers. She will use the anticipated profits from her business to improve her family's living standards.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. In the future she hopes to expand her business, make more income and be able to provide for the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian is a small-scale, Mexican dairy farmer who decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to displace the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers and turn his farm into a more cost-effective and sustainable place. 

With the biodigester, Fabian will be able to produce his own biogas and organic fertilizer from his animals' waste. The operating costs on his farm will be reduced, while his wife will cook using biogas, instead of the wood she used to collect from the surrounding area. She will not inhale the toxic smoke anymore and the animals' waste will not attract flies or contaminate underground water sources. 

Fabian will save money that he then plans to reinvest in the expansion of his farm. Further, the chemical fertilizers he used to buy for his corn field will be replaced by the nutrient-rich and potent fertilizer produced in the biodigester, increasing the fertility of his soil in a natural way.

This loan represents 45% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to buy a biodigester for his farm.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: Cornelia is 50 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Cornelia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as bread, eggs, groceries, etc. Cornelia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Cornelia would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as bread, eggs, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: José Severo

texts.en:
José Severo is a hog farmer who raises and sells pigs for a living. He spends an important part of his revenue on expensive LP gas to keep the piglets warm, as well as for his home. By investing in a biodigester, he will be able to transform what he used to consider waste into a precious resource to produce his own bio gas. By using his pigs's manure as an input to the system, the natural methanisation process will create a methane-rich bio gas, which he can connect to the house and farm. It will also provide a nutrient-rich organic fertilizer. His farm will become more cost-effective and sustainable, as the waste will no longer emit dangerous greenhouse gases or contaminate underground water sources. With the savings he will make, José Severo plans to expand his farm and improve the infrastructure around it.

This loan represents 50% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 40 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Wiliter

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Wiliter. She is a mother of 10 with a deep passion for dairy farming, which she has been doing for over 10 years. She owns a small farm in Chepwagan village which is situated in the Litein area of Kenya. The income she makes from farming is not sufficient to comfortably sustain her family. As a result, Wiliter has ventured into a couple of small side businesses to make extra shillings. With the aid of her hard-working husband, Wiliter also raises poultry and grows maize, among other crops. Wiliter is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 for constructing a cowshed. She plans to put up a well-designed barn that will provide a clean, comfortable home for her herd and a pleasant, efficient workplace for her. ITo increase milk production, the cowshed will provide a favorable environment for the cows. With your loan, Wiliter has carefully planned for the storage and handling of milk, feed, bedding and manure, as these account for most of the labor in any dairy farm. The housing will have a plentiful, dependable supply of good water, made available 24 hours a day. The income she will make from this investment will put her in a position to comfortably afford increasing farming costs. Her family also stands to benefit from the growth of their agri-business.
In addition, Wiliter hopes that if her dairy business keeps growing at a good pace so she could create at least one job in her dairy farm for a person who needs it and doesn't have job opportunities.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more products such as ready-made women clothes, incense and perfumes and resale them.

loans.name: Maia
