Mrs. Cruz is a hard-working woman with dreams of going forward. For this Christmas season, she wants to improve her sales, and it is because of this that she requests a loan to buy beans, sugar, rice, coffee, eggs, bread, etc. 

Mrs. Cruz hopes that this investment will allow her to improve her and her family’s quality of life and that she can take advantage of the Christmas season to sell a lot. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – December 2014

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, coffee, eggs, bread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
El señor Bernardo desde muy joven se dedica a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y cría de animales, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura y la ganadería, tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital comprando tres novillonas de ganado que le permitan aumentar su producción de animales, y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo.
Es padre responsable y amoroso con sus 4 hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposa quien ha sido su más grande compañía.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar podrá llegar muy lejos.
texts.en:
Since he was young, Bernardo has made a living off the functions of the field, such as agriculture and raising livestock, activities that his father taught him so that he could get ahead in life.  Today, his main profession is agriculture and cattle raising.  His objective is to improve his capital buy purchasing three heifers, which would allow him to increase his production of animals.  This is why he is requesting a loan.

He is a responsible and loving father to his four children.  He lives on a farm with them and his wife, who has been his greatest company.  He dreams of being able to give his children a quality education so that later they can take care of themselves and be independent.  Every day, he attends to his business and makes sure that he does everything very well.  He knows that with the help of the Interactuar organization, he will be able to go far.

loans.use: to purchase three heifers

loans.name: Carmelina Rosa

texts.es:
Carmelina es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Sincelejo desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, arepas, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Carmelina y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Carmelina desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina y compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas como pollos, harina, queso, entre otros.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Carmelina is a hardworking, humble woman that has dedicated much of her life to caring for her children. She lives in the town of Sincelejo where she works spectacularly in the kitchen – as her business is the preparation of meals such as tamales, sausages, empanadas and arepas, among others. 

She sells these meals primarily to her neighbors in the area, who know Carmelina’s personal touch and know that they will always get delicious, very well prepared meals. 

Carmelina wants to increase the sales of her meals and wants to work in a more comfortable way. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to purchase some kitchen utensils and ingredients for her recipes such as chickens, flour, cheese, among others.

This loan will allow Carmelina to improve her business – in order to earn the necessary income to continue supporting her family, an opportunity provided to her by Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make her recipes including chickens, flour, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Hector Fabio

texts.es:
Héctor es un campesino de 35 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 
Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de plátano y yuca, cultivos que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Turbo, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos (Ver Foto) 

Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, más productiva y así mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.

Héctor, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor is a 35-year-old farmer who is hardworking and humble. When he was a boy he learned how to carry out farm work, thanks to the teachings of his parents. 

This has allowed him to progress, and today he has plantain and yucca crops. He tends to his crops everyday and the harvests are sold in the market plaza of the municipality of Turbo. In addition, he carries out day labor work at different farms in the region, and with that he complements the income with which he looks over the wellbeing of his children (see photo). 

With the support of the requested loan from Corporación Interactuar, he will buy wholesale agricultural supplies such as manure, pesticide, fertilizer, and other things. With this he will continue caring for his crops and will have a better and more productive harvest, and in this way he will improve his income when it is time to sell his products.

Héctor, with his entrepreneurial spirit, his strength, and tenacity, wants to continue fighting to achieve his dream of having his own farm on which he can grow a much larger variety of products and in that way improve the profitability of his business, guaranteeing economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale agricultural supplies such as manure, pesticide, fertilizer, and other things.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un joven con tan solo 27 años de edad, vive en una comunidad muy bonita de Solola. 

Pedro hace tres años  se puso a analizar que trabajo puede realizar para generar ingresos económicos, pues la actividad que él eligió es la compra venta de ropa típica, él sale a vender a diferentes lugares del departamento y busca zonas más turísticas por el tipo de productos que el lleva a la venta. 

 Pedro cada día busca prosperidad en su vida, con los tres años que lleva con el negocio a podido comprar una parte de materiales para empezar con la construcción  de su casa, pero en  la vida siempre existen diversidad de necesidades, pues él se ha puesto a pensar que la solución para terminar la casa es conseguir un préstamo,   como se aprecia en la fotografía aun hace falta varios detalles de la casa. Él sueño de Pedro este año es tener su propio casa donde vivir.
texts.en:
Pedro is a young man who is 27 years of age. He lives in the beautiful community of Solola.

Three years ago, Pedro began thinking about what type of work he should do in order to generate income. The business he chose is selling traditional clothing. He travels to different places within the department and looks for busy tourist areas where he can sell this type of product.

Every day Pedro looks to become prosperous in life. In the three years that he has been in business, he was able to buy some of the materials for starting the construction of his house. However, there are always different needs in life, so he figured that the solution would be to secure a loan so that he could finish his house. The photograph shows that his house still lacks several details.

Pedro’s dream for this year is to have his own house where he can live.

loans.use: to buy construction materials so that he can finish building his house.

loans.name: Odete

texts.en:
Odete is applying for a loan of $ 900.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 27 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as beer,fanta,cocacola,sprite,sagiko,noodles,cigarettes,fish,milks, biscuits and refrigerator.She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. 
Odete is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy including students.She is happy whit this loan because to improving her living condition in the future,and her husband is a driver.

loans.use: To buy beer,fanta,cocacola,sprite,sagiko,noodles,cigarettes,fish,milks, biscuits and refrigerator

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es una mujer de 38 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 13, y un hijo varón de 9 años, y su negocio es la confección de cubre camas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Buenos Aires’ un área caracterizada por el comercio y la manufactura en todas las áreas. Talleres de sastrería, restaurantes de pollo frito, librería y todo tipo de comercios se encuentran lado a lado. De clima seco y frio, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 8-18 grados centígrados.
Paulina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza con sus hijos, ambos estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de cubrecamas para la venta por mayor. Ella recibe pedidos de sus clientes, y realiza la confección de cubrecamas de 1 plaza, 2 plazas, para niños y diseños serios para adultos. Labor que realiza en un taller alquilado cercano a su domicilio. “debido al frío de la ciudad los cubrecamas tienen mucha demanda esto hace que tenga trabajo constantemente…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y ser dueña de su marca. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina bordadora para realizar bordados en sus cubrecamas y ampliar su oferta de diseños. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Paulina solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina bordadora para ofertar mayores diseños de cubrecamas.
texts.en:
Paulina is a 38-year-old woman.  She is single and has a daughter, age 13, and a son, age 9.  Her business is making bedspreads.

She is enterprising, tenacious, responsible, and hard-working, and is a good mother.  She carries out her business in the Buenos Aires area, known for trade and manufacturing of all types.  Tailoring workshops, fried chicken restaurants, bookstores, and all types of businesses are found side by side.  It has a dry and cool climate, with temperatures that range from 8 to 18 degree Celsius throughout the day.

Paulina is tan-skinned with long, black hair, tied back.  She is short, and her native language is Aymará.  She speaks Spanish for everyday use and at her business.  She lives her life with her children.  They live in a rented home built of brick, with potable water, electricity, gas, and sewage.   Both of her children are students.  Her business is sewing bedspreads to sell wholesale.  She gets orders from her customers and does the sewing, for single and double beds, with designs for kids and more serious ones for adults.  She does her work in a rented workshop near her home.  She says, “due to the cold in the city, bedspreads are in high demand, so I always have work.”   Her dream is to expand her business and be the owner of her own brand.  She wants to make an investment in her own business through the purchase of an embroidery machine in order to make designs on her bedspreads and expand the designs she offers.  In her ten years of doing this type of work, this is her first loan sequence with the institution.

Because of these reasons, Paulina is asking for a loan to buy an embroidery machine, in order to offer more bedspread designs for sale.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine to offer more bedspread designs for sale.

loans.name: Uldarica

texts.en:
Uldarica sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies, which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will let her borrow again, an amount of 17,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional ingredients she needs to make peanut butter. She will also use the loan to buy raw products for her food stall business. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Uldarica wants to see her family always happy and contented. She hopes to succeed in all her future plans. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of raw ingredients needed in making peanut butter.

loans.name: Munaza

texts.en:
Munaza's age is 50, and she is married, living with her husband and one child in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Munaza owns a small business of clothing sales at home. She purchases clothes from the market at a low price and sells them at a profitable price in her community. The ladies of town like her garment collection and selection a lot. Her family members appreciate her for her efforts. 

Now the winter season is going to be start, she wants to buy the clothes of the winter season to sell. But she does not have money due to household expenses. She requested a loan so that she can buy clothes of the winter season to fulfill the demand. 

She wishes for the bright future of her child and her dream to provide a better education for her child. Munaza is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing to resell

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is 42, married and the father of four children. He runs a lathe machine shop in Karachi. He uses the lathe machine for shaping pieces of metal, by causing the work piece to be held and rotated by the lathe while a tool bit is advanced into the work, causing the cutting action. He has become more skillful over time. His work requires time and attention. Due to constant wear and tear, his lathe machine is not working properly, wasting time and precious earnings. Being the sole earner in the family, it is important that his income stays steady. He has developed a good network of clients organized and discipline. Khalid wants to purchase a new lathe machine for his shop; he has requested a loan to get more established and improve his living standards.

This loan will help him boost his business and increase his market outreach. Khalid Khan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new lathe machine for his shop.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is 32 years old, and she is a housewife who looks after her family consisting of five persons. 

Shumaila is trained in cloth stitching. She provides services in stitching to the people at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and variety of stitching material for her cloth stitching work including threads, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money she finds it difficult. 

So Shumaila is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan as per her requirement. Shumaila is very thankful to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and stitching material for her cloth stitching work

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba, una mujer de 51 años de edad llena de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Santa Bárbara y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos.  
Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposo y 2 hijos.
Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 24 años con el fin de salir adelante.
Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras, alimento y materiales para su galpón para abastecer su pequeño negocio.
Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Rosalba!
texts.en:
Rosalba, a 51 year-old woman, is full of dreams and aspirations for her life.  She lives on a ranch in the Santa Barbara municipality and makes a living by raising and selling chicken and eggs.  With this work, she tries to support her family, comprised of her husband and two children.  She has been doing this work for approximately 24 years in order to move forward.  

She is requesting economic assistance to purchase chickens, laying hens, feed, and materials for her ranch in order to stock her small business.  With this loan, she will be able to have a stronger and more sustainable business.  With the loan that you make today, you will be able to improve Rosalba’s life and business!

loans.use: to purchase chickens, laying hens, feed, and materials for her ranch to stock her small business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old and married with three children who go to school. Vilma works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

Vilma has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 51-year-old married woman. She is the mother of seven children. She has started a business of selling clothing. 

She wants to support her family through her business. She purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profit in the main market. 

Presently she needs to purchase some more clothes to sell. However, due to a lack of finances she is facing a problem, so she requested a loan from Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Seutaatia

texts.en:
Seutaatia is a 33-year-old mother of five children. For the past five years she has earned an income selling banana and taro chips in her village and at the market.

Seutaatia became a member of SPBD in 2009. She is now applying for a 1,000 WST loan to buy taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a frying pan, a wooden spoon and plastic bags to help her run her business. Besides providing for her family’s needs, she hopes to use her profits to build a chips store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a frying pan, a wooden spoon and plastic bags for her chips business

loans.name: Luis Orbey

texts.es:
En la minería encuentran muchas personas una oportunidad para progresar y salir delante de una manera humilde y con mucho coraje, tal es el caso de Luis que a sus 26 años es un joven con gran empuje y pasión por este oficio.
Trabaja en una de las minas del municipio de Puerto Triunfo.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de un motor para su canoa, el cual le permitirá transportarse de una manera mas ágil y rápida sin tener que realizar el esfuerzo de remar, de esta forma podrá continuar con su trabajo con el cual ha intentado obtener algunos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Una de las grandes dificultades que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de capital para invertir en su actividad.

Apoya a Luis con su oficio y haz que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo.
texts.en:
In the mining industry many people find an opportunity to progress and get ahead in a humble way and with a lot of courage. That is the case with Luis who, at 26 years of age, is a young man with great drive and passion for this profession. He works in one of the mines in the municipality of Puerto Triunfo.

He requests economic support in order to buy a motor for his canoe, which will allow him to transport himself in a more agile and fast way, without having to carry out the effort of rowing. In this way, he will be able to continue his work with which he has tried to obtain some income to support his family.

One of the great difficulties that he has had to face is the lack of capital to invest in his work.

Help Luis with his profession and make his life better with a loan.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his canoe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover repair costs for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito is 65 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with five children now at their adult age.  Tito has engaged in fishing activity for 15 years already as his main source of living to meet the needs of the family.  He earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month from doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to be used to purchase marine boards, marine nails, marine epoxy, and paints for boat repairs. Tito has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Tito hopes to acquire additional fishing boats and equipment for his existing business.

loans.use: to purchase marine boards, marine nails, marine epoxy and paints.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is age 40 and the mother of six children, living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store where he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from the profits of his own store. His relatives like to purchase from his general store. 

He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. 

Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Mariam requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses (beans), soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits. etc. 

Mariam hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way. This amount will help him to cope with the demands of their family. Mariam thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy inventories for the general store.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a market entrepreneur from Pershotravensk. She sells vegetables and fruit at a marketplace, as well as a variety of fishing accessories at a different location at the same market. Tamara bought one of her vending locations, while she is still renting the other one. She has been working as a market entrepreneur for 15 years. 

Tamara is hoping to use 40,000 hryvnia to buy assorted fishing supplies, such as fishing poles, aqua feed, fishing line, and reels to meet the demand of her clientele, as well as to set aside finances for her daughters and grandkids.

loans.use: to buy assorted fishing supplies, such as fishing poles, aqua feed, fishing line, and reels, to meet the demand of her clientele

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 61 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with one child, who is now an adult. For her source of income, Monica has a little store and sells groceries and other consumable products.

She earns approximately 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of business activity. At present, she is also receiving a monthly pension from being employed in one of the government offices in her town.  

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products to sell. Monica has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Monica hopes to establish a much bigger and complete sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Nubar

texts.en:
Nubar is a 54-year-old widow. She is IDP (Internally displaced person) and lives with her three kids in the Bilasuvar region. The main source of income for her is raising and selling seasonal vegetables (cucumbers, onions, greens, etc.) Nubar sells the crops in a local bazaar This brings her 120 AZN monthly.

She has 22 years experience. She also gets additional earnings working as a tailor in her free time because she covers her family by herself. But this income is not solving her problem.

Raising vegetables is very popular in Azerbaijan. Especially in summer they grow more than winter. She decided to change her life for the better. She needs to buy seeds and to build a hothouse in her garden.

She requested 1500 AZN. This is her first loan. Please help her.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to build a hothouse in her garden.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 43-year-old divorced mother of five children, a Palestinian refugee who opened a small cafe to cover the needs and expenses of her family since she is their sole earner. 
Aida is an ambitious woman and a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to start an additional income business parallel to the existing cafe, she will open a clothes selling shop and will buy new winter clothes collection, which will be a second source of income. This loan will help Aida increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: start an additional income business parallel to the existing cafe, she will open a clothes selling shop and will buy new winter clothes collection, which will be a second source of income.

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.en:
Khayriniso is a strong woman. She was born in 1976. She lives in a rural area and is married with three children. 

Khayriniso and her husband have an agricultural business. She has cattle and is engaged in animal husbandry. It is hard for her to maintain her family because her business is not providing a good income. Her husband’s work is seasonal, and they are currently unable to plant crops. In order to not waste any time, she is planning to to buy additional fertilizers for her plants. Khayriniso is in need of financial support for enlarging her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fertilizers for her plants

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.en:
Mavjigul is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1985. She lives in a village. Mavjigul is married and she has twin daughters. She has about a year working in the business sphere. She keeps a livestock and she likes her work. She feeds small cattle and sells them in a market.

Mavjigul is upset because her twin daughters are sick. She is searching for help. Her annual income is not enough for treating daughters. She needs financial support for the treatment of her twins.

loans.use: To pay for her daughters' medical treatment

loans.name: Diloro

texts.en:
Diloro is a strong woman, and she lives in a village. She is married and has one child. 

Diloro is a hardworking business woman. She began her business three months ago and has a business buying and selling shoes. She tries to buy  up-to-date shoes to get more clients. With this aim she took part in a course 'To Get Ahead' of women organization and got a certificate. She got useful information for herself.

Now,she needs to financial support. She wants to buy seasonal shoes to increase the working capital of her new business and in this way to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy seasonal shoes to increase working capital

loans.name: Icel

texts.en: Icel is a 23 year old married woman and a mother of two children from Iloilo, Philippines.  She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for seven years now. Fishing is their main source of income. Icel is requesting to take a loan to buy a new engine for the fishing boat. With a loan, Icel and her husband will be able to improve their catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Icel hopes to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the fishing boat

loans.name: Maravida

texts.en:
Maravida is 34 years old. Maravida works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Maravida runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, rice, beverages, etc.

Maravida has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Maravida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, rice, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 34 years old, and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

Riza is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo, fish net and a boat.

Riza has been fishing for six years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing, like bamboo, fish net and pamboat

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 26 years old, married, and has one child.

She is engage if fishing business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy material for fishing, like fish net, bamboo and a boat.

Analyn has been for 5 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy material for fishing, like fish net, bamboo and a boat

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Esperanza works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Esperanza is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Esperanza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en:
A $ 600.00 is offered to Martinha to improve her business. she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as cigarettes,sugar,salt,milks,fish,coca cola,sagiko,water and bread.She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Martinha independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes,sugar,salt,milks,fish,cocacola,sagiko,water and bread

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Ali. He is married and he and his wife have been blessed with a nine-year-old son. They live in Depok, a satellite city located at the south border of Jakarta. Depok is a developing city in which suburban people live and commute to Jakarta to work. Nevertheless, only some part of Depok has been well-developed; there are still many areas where access to financial services is rare. 

Joining as a Ruma agent for more than three months, Ali owns and manages a shop selling mobile phones and accessories, mobile phone airtime credits and a utility bill payment service. He is providing mobile services in his community. Now, as the business runs, the number of mobile service transactions in his shop is increasing and he needs more working capital to fulfill it. Therefore, Ali is requesting a Kiva loan to provide working capital in order to process more transactions in his community. In the photo, Ali is in his mobile shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 24 years old, married, and she has two children. She lives in the center of the market. She had an idea to open a food restaurant for everybody to come eat. She is earning a good income everyday, because many people come to eat in her restaurant.  She is very happy with her business, and now she wants to buy more materials for her restaurant such as rice, chicken, beef, pork, fish, noodles, seasonings and other materials. 

She is applying for a loan of USD 600 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital, so that she can use it to improve her business, because she wants to open a bigger restaurant in the future. She opened the restaurant in 2013 with her own working capital of USD 400.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, beef, pork, fish, noodles, seasoning and other materials for her restaurant.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 56 years old. She is a widow and a mother of two children.  After the death of her husband it was not possible to meet household expenses alone. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase more spools of threads, needles, cloth and buttons in different colors. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate more income for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, needles, cloth and buttons in different colors to stitch up more dresses on time to generate more income for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Nhóm 11 - Định Hóa 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tho is a member of Nhom 11 - Dinh Hoa 01 Group. She is pictured first on the right, in the first row. Tho is 40 years old and works in agricultural production, with a monthly income of VND 450,000. She is married and has three children. She is pregnant and her husband just passed away. Her family is nearly poor. 

With this loan, Tho will install a toilet that will improve the quality of life for her family members and help the community to avoid diseases and infections, commonly associated with unsanitary toilets.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Nhóm 5 - Lưu Phương 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan, pictured first from the left, is 29 years old and has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2010. She and her husband work in agriculture production where they earn a monthly income of about VND 500,000 ($24). In order to have enough to raise their two children, her husband also works as a cyclo driver while she collects garbage around the village. 

Currently, their family uses an unsafe, unhygienic latrine. With this VND 8,000,000 loan, she can build a hygienic toilet in her home, which will improve her family's living conditions and contribute to the sanitary improvement of the entire community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Sothy's Group

texts.en: Sothy’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sothy works as a farm laborer and he also does extra work as a seller by selling bread to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time by not having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kurmanjan

texts.en:
Kurmanjan is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia. Here is her story:

“I am applying for a Kiva loan to be able to better myself and my family’s financial situation, and to gain my goals.

Every youth should get a higher education for successful life. If you have higher education, you can find a good job, work for your pleasure, and live with your family in abundance. Without it, you will have narrow horizons, less opportunity for good life and always do physical jobs. I wish to be a well-educated, broad-minded and promising person.

I have a big family of six: my mother, three brothers, me and my little sister. My mother supports us alone, because several years ago we lost my father. She is a teacher at school. Public servers in our country get so little salary, not enough for living. As a big family, we need food, clothes, and utilities. My elder brother has an extramural study in order to work at the same time to pay for his tuition. My mother’s 135 dollars per month salary doesn’t cover the whole family’s daily necessities. My other siblings study at school and get a pension for the loss of a breadwinner. And sometimes I help my aunt to sell her goods in the market.

I want to change my life, I want to begin a new life to succeed in the future. For this purpose I am requesting a Kiva loan, which will be the first step for my bright future.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Nhóm 12 - Lưu Phương 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuoi, 55, is a single mom with one child still in school. She has been an active member of the Women's Union since 1995. Her family is a poor family. She has bad health and gets sick frequently. Her family does not have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will have a hygienic toilet installed in her home. This will improve the health of her family members and contribute to environmental protection. 

In the picture, Tuoi is the first person from the left.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Chamunda Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Devalben (in the center in the picture) is a 48-year-old uneducated woman from Kutch in Gujarat. To support her family’s meager income, she set up a photo studio. Due to her hard work and business acumen, it has grown. Her photo studio now contributes significantly to over 50% of her family’s monthly earnings. 

Devalben, however, realizes that to provide adequately for their later years, as she and her husband age, they will need more than the Rs. 15,000 that now comes in. Her family also includes a young pre-school aged child. As she did not have the opportunity to go to school, she understands too well how it limited the opportunities to uplift her family from poverty. So she wants to leave some savings behind, contributing towards the child’s further education. 

To make all these hopes a reality, Devalben needs to earn more through her small-scale business. For the further growth of her photo studio microenterprise, she needs to invest in a computer. With the help of technology, she will be able to provide a wider array of photographic services, which will also command a higher price, and, thereby, result in an increased income. She will also be able to service more customers, as she will be able to provide services in a shorter turnaround. 

To source the capital for this investment in computerizing her photo shop, Devalben formed a group with four other enterprising women: Valbai, who runs a petty shop; Manbai, who makes and sells "papads," a local snack; Ganga, a tailor; and Mina, who sells accessories locally known as "cutlery." Devalben and her group members are entrepreneurial and hardworking, but lack capital to expand their ventures, so they need a loan of Rs. 75,000.

loans.use: to computerize her photo studio so she can cater to more customers

loans.name: Jatin Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Alpaben, 33, pictured at the center in a traditional blue kurti, leads this group of five women from Chandkheda in India’s western state of Gujarat. She is a hardworking mother of two children. There is more to Alpaben than running her household and tending to the needs of her school-going children. She runs a successful and thriving tailoring microenterprise. Making colorful dresses and garments is her best tailoring skill, although she also makes home textiles that include bed sheets, pillow covers, and curtains. 

Alpaben is one of a fortunate few to have successfully completed a secondary education, an opportunity that she hopes she can also afford for her children. The rising cost of quality education and the general cost of living is something that concerns her constantly. In order to increase her savings and thereby offer her children a respectable education, she intends to expand the size of her small-scale business. With the assistance of a loan, she will be able to purchase additional tailoring aids and higher quality material that will increase the demand for her products. 

Among her group members, Chandanben, and Sonalben are also looking to expand their tailoring businesses, and Savitaben runs a sari business. Sunitabevi runs a successful business that makes ‘torans’, a traditional decorative artwork, typically made of cloth, that adorns the arches of homes in her town. They jointly seek a loan of Rs. 70,000. Your loan will help them to expand their businesses with the ultimate goal of increasing their savings and being able to afford their children better care and a quality education.

loans.use: To expand her microenterprise by buying a fresh bulk stock of cloth materials and tailoring aids

loans.name: Dhruv Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Jamnaben, the group leader who is at the center of the image, is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family of four by running her own small business selling vegetables. She buys vegetables at wholesale rates from the larger market in town and sells them locally at a profit. She manages to garner Rs. 3000 per month (~$50), which forms a part of her monthly family income of Rs. 11,000. This income supports her family of four. 

Seeing a potential for growth and given the demand from her customers, Jamnaben wants to start buying vegetables like tomatoes, okra, eggplant, potatoes, and chilies in larger quantity. She will be able to cater to her customers’ demand for these and earn more each month. Increasing her order for these vegetables means she will also be able to negotiate a better purchase rate from her suppliers, improving her profit margins. Put together, this will aid in increasing her monthly income by 60% to Rs. 5,000 (~$80). The additional income will help her family to better their living standards and become more stable financially. 

Seeing similar potential for growth in the individual small businesses they run, and hoping to use this to improve their families’ situations, Laxmiben, Kavitaben, Lataben, and Vishitaben have joined with Jamnaben to form a group. They intend to use their microfinance loans to buy inventory and equipment to scale up their respective general shop, cycle repairs service, and tailoring microenterprises. 

The group, as a whole, seek a loan of Rs. 65,000, to invest in the growth of their small businesses. These women are industrious and resolute for the betterment of their families. The added income would be a boon for them. They are grateful for your support and this opportunity to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, okra, potatoes, eggplants, and chilies and grow her vegetable-selling microenterprise

loans.name: Jay Gelma Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Jashuben, aged 28 and pictured in the middle in the group above, is a resident of Surendranagar district in the state of Gujarat. She runs a small animal husbandry microenterprise. Her small-scale business forms the bedrock of support for her family of five that also includes three school-going children. Besides being a regular source of income, the milk and by-products of the animal produce are an important source of nutrition for her growing children. 

Despite the good run she has experienced with her venture, Jashuben’s position is rather precarious. With just a little over Rs. 4000 in monthly savings, her family is constantly at risk of falling into financial strain. Even a common fever is enough to wipe out her monthly savings. Sensing that she must do something to increase her savings for a rainy day and to give her children a complete education, Jashuben is keen on expanding her small-scale business with the help of a loan. The loan, granted on reasonable rates, will give her the opportunity she needs to quickly scale up the size of her business.

The lives and stories of Sonalben and Sajuben mirror that of Jashuben, and the three women share a longstanding friendship, running their own animal husbandry microenterprises that they seek to grow. Rupaben and Anuben, the two other women in the group, run sewing businesses. Together, these five women seek to crowdfund a microloan of Rs. 69,000. Your loan will help Jashuben and her group to scale up their businesses quickly without getting ensnared in a debt trap. A year from today, their lives will be different for the better.

loans.use: to buy more animals and increase the size of her fledgling animal husbandry microenterprise

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
A 32-year-old mother of five, Sou operates a small business selling pancakes, buns and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than five years. 

Sou has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, fry pan and vegetable oil to help her run the business. Sou hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profits. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, fry pan and vegetable oil

loans.name: Rellana

texts.en:
Rellana, a hardworking and industrious mother, is known in her neighborhood for her "tuba" (coconut wine)  that she sells. This is how she has supported her husband in raising their six children.

Rellana is a member of PMPC and appreciates the various programs and services that the co-op offers. With a good repayment record, she is now requesting a loan to help pay for more gallons of "tuba" (coconut wine) to sell. 

Rellana is thankful for the fact that all of her financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for more gallons of "tuba" (coconut wine) to sell

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Torcuata

texts.en: Torcuata has considerable preparation for the post harvest operations of her corn in Lopez Jaena. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the shelling, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and made a loan. Torcuata hopes to live and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Lydia has a bakery business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bread production business. She has been in this business for 20 years. Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bread production business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 29 and she is married. She lives with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Shazia purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this since 2009, and now she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to utilize her experience and wants to generate more profits, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to the upcoming marriage season, the demand for clothing will increase as well. 

This is the reason Shazia showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming cloths for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell by herself in her locality.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer emprendedora de 46 años de edad, madre de tres hijos y convive con su compañero sentimental en unión libre. 

Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes talleres de confecciones como operaria de máquina, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; pero, ya cansada de trabajar en otros talleres y con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con sus hijos, decidió emprender su propio taller de confección, para lo cual desea comprar una maquina recubridora, una maquina plana, una maquina fileteadora e insumos de confección como tela e hilos. 

Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado. 

Con su empuje y ambición se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo generando empleo siempre de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar
texts.en:
Mariais a 46 year old enterprising woman and mother of three who lives with her common-law partner. During her working life she has worked in different sewing workshops as a machine operator. So she has experience and knowledge in managing this type of business.

But tired of working in other people's workshops and wanting to spend more time with her children she decided to start her own sewing workshop. So she wants to buy a lock-stitch sew machine, an cover-stitch sewing machine, a flat table machine and sewing supplies like needles and thread.

This will allow her to start her production which she hopes will generate a good impact in the market to provide suitable profits and thus fulfill her dream of positioning herself in the market. With her drive and ambition she looks at a middle future generating employment always with the help of the Interactuar Corporation.

loans.use: to buy a lock-stitch sew machine, an cover-stitch sewing machine, a flat table machine and sewing supplies like needles and thread.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is 18 years old and runs a small business selling elei printing in her community. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Sera has requested for a loan to buy a rolling materials, paint colours, paint brushes, and elei carved designs to run the business. She will expand her business by using her profits. 

Sera joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint colours, paint brushes, and elei carved designs.

loans.name: Vazir

texts.en:
Vazir is married and has two children. His son studies second course at college and his daughter goes to eleventh class. Vazir’s wife is a housewife and also helps Vazir with his business. His family is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli city for already 22 years.  Now they  live in the Füzuli region.  

Vazir has cows. Vazir and his wife made milk and milky products (yogurt, cheese and etc.) then sell in bazar. Now Vazir wants to buy more cows for  improve his business . Therefore he needs  a loan amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

Vazir is thankful for the help from Kiva and it's lenders.

loans.use: to buy cows, increase business and improve quality.

loans.name: Tailua

texts.en:
Tailua is a 19-year-old lady who runs a small business selling elei printing in her community. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Tailua has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint colors, a paint brush, and elei designs to run the business. She will expand her business by using her profits. 

Tailua joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint colors, a paint brush, and elei designs.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is the age of 50 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children; three of them sit idle at home. 

Her husband has been running a restaurant for many years and handling the financial condition of his house. This restaurant has been supporting his whole family for many years. Nowadays, he wants to offer more menus to his valuable customers, so that he can grow his income.

Naseem is requesting a loan for the restaurant establishment. In fact, her husband wants to buy plastic furniture, chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. Naseem is hopeful that this loan will generate more profits and savings, as well. Naseem thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy plastic furniture, chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy compound animal feed.

loans.name: Namiq

texts.en:
Namiq is 28 years old, married, and he has two kids. Namiq is furniture master, he  has been involved in this business for more than eight years. He lives and works in Agsu region. He is very happy to be able to improve the conditions of his house little by little. This is his first loan with Agroinvest CU. 
The main hardship that Namiq faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,200 azn to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Namiq hopes for his business to do well. He also hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel his house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 37 years old and married.

Lorna earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Lorna is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorna has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from general store.

Lorna is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to buy more products for his hardware store to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the sewer line and to replace the pipes and toilet so that she and her family can enjoy sanitary conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her barn.

loans.name: Abed El Karim

texts.en:
Abed El Karim is a 45-year-old married father of two children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, four years ago he opened a cafe shop inside the camp where he sells coffee and hookah to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Abed El Karim is suffering from the limited number of customers inside the camp and he is trying hard to develop his business. That's why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy different kinds of coffee to satisfy his customers' needs.
 
Abed El Karim hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of coffee to satisfy his customers' needs

loans.name: Ana Nelly

texts.es:
Ana es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de enfermería.
Ella es inteligente, responsable, comprometida, constante, dulce, cariñosa, sensible y sincera. Sus estudios lo realiza en un instituto técnico de excelencia en la zona de ‘Chasquipampa’, área que antiguamente era sitio de pastoreo de ganado y casas construidas de adobe, actualmente se encuentra totalmente urbanizado, de clima templado en verano y muy frio en invierno.
Ana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo peinado a la moda, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no utiliza porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a sus padres que trabajan como comerciantes y su madre tiene una tienda de barrio, todos viven en una casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de luz, agua y alcantarillado. Ella cursa la carrera de enfermería y se encuentra en 1 año de 3 años que dura la carrera; disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta entender los síntomas de enfermedad, su carácter es de servicio. Su sueño es ser profesional para conseguir un buen empleo y desea pagar las cuotas de su carrera. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica al estudio profesional.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su instituto y  terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
19-year old Ana is a single young woman, without children, who is studying to be a nurse. She is intelligent, responsible, committed, steady, charming, loving, sensitive, and sincere. 

She attends classes at an excellent technical institute in the area of Chasquipampa which in the past was a place where cattle grazed and the houses were made of adobe. Now it is totally built up. The climate is mild in summer and very cold in winter.

Ana is dark skinned with long black hair in a fashionable style. Her native language is Aymará but she no longer speaks it as she is studying and lives in the town with her parents who run businesses. Her mother runs a nearby store. They live in their own house which has electricity, water, and sewage. 

Ana is studying nursing and is in her first year of three. She enjoys helping people and likes hearing about the symptoms of their illnesses. Serving people is part of her character. Her dream is to become a professional with a good job. She now wishes to obtain a loan to pay for her university courses. This is the first loan she has had with the institution in the one year she has been taking courses. She will then be able to complete her nursing studies.

loans.use: pay for her courses and complete her training to become a nurse

loans.name: Mavlonzoda

texts.en: Gulruhsor is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1991. She lives in a village. She is married. She has two children. Her husband is a master. Her major is sewing. But she does not have a sewing machine to work with. In about six months, she is planning to open her business. She wants to open a small sewing factory. Gulruhsor wants to serve women by sewing clothes for women. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing new business

loans.name: Mariame

texts.en:
Mariame is a 29-year-old Lebanese woman. She is married and living with three kids and her husband, who is the main income provider and working hard and doing a great effort to support his family. Five years ago, and in order to help her husband with the household expenses, she started teaching private lessons. Her work is based at her own house, where she welcomes her students to teach them. 

Today, Mariame is asking to borrow a youth loan form Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a scientific encyclopedia to improve the school.

loans.use: to purchase a scientific encyclopedia to improve the school

loans.name: Phượng

texts.en:
Phượng works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle.

Phượng is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Phượng lives with in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phượng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Phượng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Phượng faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Phượng hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Phương

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương works in agriculture farming food.

Phương is 30 years old and she is married with 1 children.
She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

In 2012, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phương has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Phương has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main harship that Phương faces in her life is not having clean water syterm and hygeinic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet and bath-room.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Tiền

texts.en:
Mr. Tiền operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat.
Tiền is 33 years old, and he is married with two children.
He lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.
This is Tiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Tiền has been involved in his business for seven years.
The main hardship that Tiền faces in his life is not having a biogas system. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand and equipment to build a biogas system.
In the future, Tiền hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand and equipment to build a biogas system

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is involved in a business direct selling soap, shampoo and cosmetics. Her customers are mostly her friends and she wanted to give them good products and services.

She is now asking for additional capital of 5,000 PHP to buy Avon products such as cosmetics, perfume, soap and shampoo to sell. She hopes to gain good income from her small business and invest in improving it for the overall welfare of her family. Her photo was taken with the Project Unit Supervisor who validated her business.

loans.use: to buy Avon products such as cosmetics, perfume, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is 54 years old and she is married with one child. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Nhung works in agriculture farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Nhung faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. 
This is  Nhung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
With her business profit, Nhung hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is from Leyte, Philippines and is a married mother of 3 children. She runs a small sari-sari, or retail store, selling various goods and food items to the people in her community. She has been running her business for more than 4 years now.

Luisa is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, bread and biscuits, etc. With this loan, she will be able to improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

Luisa hopes to make her business a success in the future. Moreover, she wishes to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, bread and biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Lotchie

texts.en:
Lotchie is a farmer from Leyte, Philippines. She is 34 years old, married and has two children, ages 10 and 9. Lotchie has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than 10 years now.  

Lotchie is requesting to take a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. This loan will help her and her husband in improving their rice farming business, thus augmenting their harvest and income. In the future, Lotchie has hopes of making their farming business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en: Norlita runs a small sari-sari or retail store business in her place. She sells goods like soap, canned goods, snack foods and others. Norlita has been in the business for more than two years now. Norlita is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and biscuits. With a loan, Norlita will be able to improve and increase her inventories, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Norlita hopes to make her business more profitable and stable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and biscuits

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 27 years old and has two children who are in school.

Aiza has a peanut processing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more cacao seeds for processing.

Aiza has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 55 years old and married, with six children who are in school, Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a shoe sell business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of Avon shoes to sell

Lydia has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of Avon shoes to sell

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.

Rodelia has been in this business for 10 years. Rodelia earns more income from buying and selling recyclable materials and general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rodelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 46 years old and married.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lilibeth is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilibeth has been in pig fattening for 27 years and also earns additional income from tailoring.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives in Kapan city of the Syunik region. Now Ruzanna lives alone as she is divorced. Her son now is abroad and her daughter is married and she lives with her family. 

Ruzanna graduated Kapan city’s vocal college, and since 1983 till today, she works in this college as a teacher of vocal. As she says, she likes her work very much and since she lives alone now, all of her time she devotes to her pupils, who come also to her flat for having vocal lessons. Ruzanna says that despite working with great pleasure, she sometimes feels tired and weakness during her working day. As she says, she is very upset about it, since it greatly disturbs her ability to manage all her planned work and lessons.

This loan she will use for passing medical examination, with the hope of that there would be nothing serious.

loans.use: to pass medical examination, with the hope of nothing serious

loans.name: Elena De Jesus

texts.es:
Ella es Elena una adorable, amigable, sonriente, y tierna abuelita de 61 años de edad, vive con su pareja, no tiene hijos, depende de lo que su marido puede traer a su hogar y con ello sobreviven.
Pensando en mejorar sus condiciones de vida Elena quiere solicitar un crédito para iniciar formalmente su negocio que será una tienda de dulces, chocolates y productos de la canasta familiar de primera necesidad, para ella será indispensable tu ayuda pues representara una manera más digna de vivir al tener una entrada de dinero más constante.
Con el crédito solicitado comprara frituras, refrescos, chocolates, granos y abarrotes.
texts.en: Elena is an adorable, friendly, smiling and loving grandmother of 61 years of age. She lives with her spouse and has no children. She is dependent on what her husband brings home to the house and they live on this. Thinking of improving the conditions of her life Elena wants to request a loan to formally start her business which will be a store selling sweets, chocolate and basic needs goods. Your help will be indispensable for her as it represents a more dignified way of living having a more consistent source of income. With the requested loan she will buy fried foods, soft drinks, chocolates, grains and groceries.

loans.use: to start her business, a general store buying sweets, grains and chocolates. It will be her only source of income at 61 years old.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 42 years old and has three children. Two of her children are in school.

Corazon is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Corazon has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo tiene 68 años de edad, tiene una hermosa familia de 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.

Domingo es un hombre que tiene mucha experiencia de trabajo mayormente el tiene un trabajo muy minucioso y alegórico, ya que él se dedica desde hace muchos años a la elaboración de cortes típicos, este producto se elabora en telar de pie. El corte típico es una de las piezas de vestimenta que usan  las mujeres de la región donde él vive. En los tiempos libres Domingo también se dedica a la agricultura que es otra de las actividades más para generar sus ingresos. A pesar de que Domingo es una persona mayor de edad, a él no le gusta perder su tiempo. 

Domingo para seguir elaborando mas cortes,  necesita un préstamo para  tener un capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima tales como (Hilos y jaspes de todos los colores), Con estas dos actividades domingo a logrado  progresar con su familia, el anhelo de él ahora es contar con un local donde pueda exhibir sus cortes.
texts.en:
Domingo is 68 years old and has a wonderful family consisting of four adult children. He lives in the community of Solalá and has a lot of work experience. For the most part he has worked for many years at the painstaking job of making lengths of traditional cloth for which he uses a loom operated by foot. 

The lengths of cloth that he weaves are one of the items of traditional clothing worn by the women of the area where he lives.

In his spare time Domingo is also involved in farming to earn extra income. In spite of being of advanced years he does not like to waste his time.

In order to continue his weaving, he needs a loan to buy basic supplies such as thread and birthstones of all colours. With his two jobs Domingo has managed to help his family get ahead. His challenge now is to find premises where he can display his weavings.

loans.use: buy weaving supplies

loans.name: Elif

texts.en:
Elif  is married and has two children. She sells Amway products. With this loan,she will buy more products. Elif began this work to support her family and pay for her children’s education. Her circle has expanded, her self confidence has increased, and the income is good, she says. She likes her work. Elif says one advantage is that she is able to divide her time between her house and children. Her dream is to buy a house.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Elif Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  İki yıldır Amway ürünlerinin satışını yapıyor.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile ürün alacak.  Ailesine katkı sağlamak ve çocuklarının eğitim ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için bu işe başlıyor.  Çevresi genişliyor,kendine olan güveni artıyor ve kazanmanın çok güzel olduğunu vurguluyor.  İşini seviyor.  Çocuklarına ve evine rahatlıkla zaman ayırabildiği için bu işin avantajlarının çok olduğunu belirtiyor.  Hayali ev sahibi olmak.

loans.use: to buy more Amway products

loans.name: Nhóm 5 - Định Hóa 01 Group

texts.en: Quy, pictured first to the left, is a 61-year-old farmer who makes about 500,000 VND per month. Her family does not have a sanitary toilet. With this loan, Quy will build a sanitary toilet that will help to improve her family's quality of life and to stay healthy by avoiding diseases and infections associated with using an unsafe latrine. Her household is listed as a low income family. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1999.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz, who is aged 40, lives with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Shehnaz's son is providing services for polishing the newly constructed floors. He polishes the concrete and marble floors. For this purpose he uses a marble polishing machine; he has been providing these services for many years. His floor polishing machine has become out of order due to fluctuations in electricity. Shehnaz's son wants to buy a new machine, but he does not have enough cash on hand to buy a new marble polishing machine. 

Therefore, Shehnaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son will be able to buy a new marble polishing machine so that he can continue his services smoothly. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new marble polishing machine for her son's marble work

loans.name: Layla

texts.en: Layla is a conservative woman so she asked her daughter Ayat to appear in the photo in her place. One of Halima's children is Ayat, a 22-year-old single lady. Ayat goes to a university to get a bachelor's degree. Enrolling her in a university was expensive for them. Now Ayat is in her last year and he needs to buy some books and register for next semester, which they can’t afford at this time. For this reason, Layla applied for this loan to help her daughter pay the registration fee for the semester and buy the needed books to help him pass and get his certificate.

loans.use: To pay the registration fee for the semester and buy the needed books .

loans.name: Raja Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Khursida (at center in the picture) leads a group of five zealous women from Dahod, Gujarat, all of them are married and running their own small businesses to keep their families financially afloat. 

Forty-one-year-old Khursida, for instance, brings in Rs. 4000 a month, contributing to 40% of her total family income. She runs a small garage, repairing motor vehicles. For a woman from a small town in Gujarat, educated only till the 4th grade due to poor economic conditions, this is quite an achievement. Adept with finances, she saves Rs. 3000 after providing for her family of three, including her teen-aged child. 

There is scope for her to earn more, though. Her town is situated on the heavily used arterial road that connects the important cities of Ahmedabad and Vadodara from Gujarat to Indore in Madhya Pradesh. There is always a demand for good mechanics, and Khursida wants to capitalize on this. She wants to rent out some workshop space for her garage, so she is more accessible to potential customers. She also needs to buy new tools like spanners, wrenches, a workbench, and a lathe. Khursida, however, cannot spare the finances to put down a deposit for the workshop rental space and to buy her costly hardware. 

So to raise this capital, Khursida has formed a joint liability group with Abedabibi, who also runs a garage service, and Sakesa, Mksudabibi, and Salmaben, who run poultry microenterprises. As a group, they hope to access the microfinance necessary to grow their small businesses through crowdfunding. They seek a loan of Rs. 64,000. 

Khursidabibi has high hopes for her child, wanting to provide the best education she can afford. She believes providing a public college education will give her child access to a range of opportunities that can improve their lives. Your loan will help Khursida guarantee a complete education for her child and develop sustainable finances to support her family as she ages. She is glad to have this opportunity to uplift her family through honest and diligent labor.

loans.use: to rent workshop space and buy tools like spanners, wrenches, a lathe, and a workbench for her small vehicle-repairing business

loans.name: Laxmi Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Navlibe (at center in the picture), a strong and confident woman from rural Gangardi in Dahod, Gujarat, has formed a group along with two other women. Along with Kamliben and Shardaben, she seeks a loan of Rs. 45,000, to develop their respective microbusinesses.
